videos.title: Let's Get Fit | ASL Version | Count to 100 | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Teach your children to count to 100 as they get some great exercise too in this updated 2020 version of  Let's Get Fit, Count to 100 version 2. 
       This ASL version has a signed interpreter beside Jack for the Deaf and Hard - of-Hearing and as a great way for hearing students to learn sign language.  Pamela Mascitto's passion for providing equal access for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing people has led her to being a K-12 sign language interpreter for thirteen years, working at schools both in Hawai'i, where she grew up, and in Texas, where she lives currently. She has a degree in Educational Interpreting from Kapi'olani Community College and has both a National Interpreter Certification from the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (NIC) and a Board for Evaluation of Interpreters Advanced Certification (BEI).This version has an ASL Instructor 
 This cool kid-friendly song starts out with a message about staying healthy and fit and having fun counting to 100 together.   It's a great count to 100 song for Kindergarten.
I show the children simple, easy to do exercises for each 10 numbers. Children have a variety of gross motor movements to do as they count to 100. 
    The songs great beat and steady counting motivate children to keep moving all the way to 100. We show the numbers  from 1 to 100 very large and clear so children also get the visual number recognition and stimulation. 
    This count to 100 song will engage your children with the catchy up tempo music, the clear numeral visuals and seeing Jack sing and demonstrate the exercises.
     Use Count to 100 - Let's Get Fit every day to strengthen your children's ability to count to 100 and help them enjoy and have fun exercising  too.
     Counting to 100 and basic number recognition is a standard in most early childhood ( pre-k, K and 1st grade)  classrooms.
This is a great math song to start your day with, as a brain break or use it during indoor recess. 
    PE Teachers will love  Count to 100 too as it emphasizes physical education and aerobic exercise as children count to 100.

Lyrics:

Keep your mind and body in shape
Let’s get fit

Count to 100 by 1's

videos.title: There's So Much You Can Do | Jack Hartmann Don't Give Up
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann wrote There's So Much You Can Do to show children who are going through this difficult time that there are better days ahead and there is still so much we can do to be positive each day. Be strong, be brave and keep on trying. Never give up, don't stop, there's so much you can do. Jack Hartmann There's So Much You Can Do encourages children to don't give up, there are better days ahead.

videos.title: Zero the Hero | ASL Version | Jack Hartmann | Count to 100
videos.description:
Zero the Hero helps kids exercise and learn to count to 100. This is a great song to engage your children in movement and practice counting to 100.  This song is perfect to have some Zero the Hero fun to celebrate 100 days of school. This is our ASL version of Zero the Hero.
This count to 100 song features the popular fictional character Zero the Hero who flies in with Zeros so children can count beyond the number 9. Zero the Hero places the zero (0) to hold the place for the tens (10's), hundreds (100's), thousands (1,000's) and on to infinity. Wow, those zeroes are important! Zero the Hero is a big, cool, super character that helps make math fun. At your school or home, anyone can dress up a little bit and have fun with playing the part of Zero the Hero.
Teachers and parents all over the world do dress up as Zero the Hero to help children understand how important those zeros (0's) are to hold the place for numbers to go beyond single digit numbers.
So, count to 100 and follow Zero the Hero while exercising, getting smarter, stronger and healthier.
Just for your information, I wrote this song, but our count to 100 Zero the Hero character, is played by our friend Mark. He was a good sport to do this, and is a really great guy. By the way, he really is that big! He bench presses almost 500 lbs, dose curls with 200 lbs, has 22 inch biceps and works out 2 hrs a day five days a week ! He's also a stay at home dad with 6 children. Wow! 
Have fun exercising with Zero the Hero and learning to count to 100.
  Pamela Mascitto's passion for providing equal access for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing people has led her to become a K-12 sign language interpreter for thirteen years, working at schools both in Hawai'i, where she grew up, and in Texas, where she lives currently. She has a degree in Educational Interpreting from Kapi'olani Community College and has both a National Interpreter Certification from the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (NIC) and a Board for Evaluation of Interpreters Advanced Certification (BEI).
Lyrics
He's got big muscles, a cool cape

videos.title: I'm Going to Make This An Awesome Day | ASL Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
I'm Going to Make This an Awesome Day ASL version will start your student's day off right. This song demonstrates determination, empowerment and achievement while working together and independently.  It all starts with a positive determination knowing, I'm Gonna Make this an Awesome Day!  Jack Hartmann's awesome day song.
Pamela Mascitto's passion for providing equal access for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing people has led her to become a K-12 sign language interpreter for thirteen years, working at schools both in Hawai'i, where she grew up, and in Texas, where she lives currently. She has a degree in Educational Interpreting from Kapi'olani Community College and has both a National Interpreter Certification from the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (NIC) and a Board for Evaluation of Interpreters Advanced Certification (BEI).

videos.title: Greeters From Two Metres | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann shows helpful ways to greet someone from two metres in Greeters from 2 Metres.  Follow along with the fun ways to greet from a distance of 2 metres. Give a peace sign, give an air high five, give an air hug,  hold a hand to your heart,  give an air fist pump and raise the roof. You can greet from 2 metres safely by saying hello in all these safe ways. Jack Hartmann reinforces the most important thing is keep your hands off your face. This song shows we can still show love and respect without touching someone.

videos.title: Ridin' on the Bus | The Wheels on the Bus Song | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's "Ridin' On the Bus" is a fun upbeat twist on the popular children's classic song,           " The Wheels on the Bus." 
Instead of the more negative actions on the bus like babies crying in the original version, we have the babies having more fun and playing Peek -a -Boo! 
Your children will really enjoy singing and moving to all the interesting characters on the bus and follow their actions and words. This song will truly engage your children with lots of singing, laughing and moving their bodies. This is a great song for sequencing and allowing students to remember and name the order of the different characters on the bus.
  As an extension activity follow up, discuss what characters the children remember, and which character is their favorite. This activity can help build memory and comprehension skills. Your children may also have fun drawing a picture of their favorite character and say why it is their favorite. This activity really help hand/ eye coordination and fine motor coordination. Extend this activity even more by asking children if they can say the order of the different characters. This activity can help with developing awareness of ordering and sequencing which are important skills to strengthen in young children.
  It's one of those songs for Pre-K and Kindergarten that when it's done you'll hear, "Can we do it again?" Great for circle time and anytime during the day when you need to get some wiggles out as a brain break for building bodies and brains.

videos.title: Beautiful Day | ASL Version | Jack Hartmann Beautiful Day
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's A Beautiful Day  ASL version shows us there is beauty all around us everyday and this song is about taking the time to look around each day and recognize the beautiful things in our world that help make it a beautiful day. This American Sign Language version shows the signs for Jack Hartmann Beautiful Day Song.  It's a Beautiful Day will help your kids to find the joy in each day.
Jack Hartmann's ASL A Beautiful Day song celebrates the beautiful things to celebrate each day.
Pamela Mascitto's passion for providing equal access for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing people has led her to become a K-12 sign language interpreter for thirteen years, working at schools both in Hawai'i, where she grew up, and in Texas, where she lives currently. She has a degree in Educational Interpreting from Kapi'olani Community College and has both a National Interpreter Certification from the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (NIC) and a Board for Evaluation of Interpreters Advanced Certification (BEI).

videos.title: Exercise and Count by 5's | ASL Version | Jack Hartmann| Count to 100 by 5
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's Exercise and  Count by 5's to 100  ALS version. It's easy to count by 5 !  Kids count by 5 as they exercise  by stretching their arms and legs and across the midline of their bodies. This help kids with engaging both their bodies and their minds. Count to 100 by 5.
  My video, Exercise and Count by 5's is a classroom hit across the world. It's cool Latin beat makes it easy to exercise and count by 5.
    Making exercise and learning fun for kids is important for their physical and emotional growth. Exercise and Count by 5's does this beautifully as well as develop children's gross motor movements. This is a fun way to teach kids to count by 5.
Follow along with me and count by 5 out loud and exercise!
Pamela Mascitto's passion for providing equal access for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing people has led her to become a K-12 sign language interpreter for thirteen years, working at schools both in Hawai'i, where she grew up, and in Texas, where she lives currently. She has a degree in Educational Interpreting from Kapi'olani Community College and has both a National Interpreter Certification from the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (NIC) and a Board for Evaluation of Interpreters Advanced Certification (BEI).

videos.title: 12 Months of the Year Line Dance | Southern Hemisphere |Months of the Year Song Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Get ready to sing, dance and learn the months of the year in Jack Hartmann's The 12 Months of the Year. This is a fun country line dance months of the year song. Your children can follow my country dance moves as they sing the sequence of the 12 months of the year in the Southern Hemisphere. 
     Step front and back with your right foot as you say each month from Jan. to June, and then, on July, hop forward. Then use your left foot and step front and back from Aug. to Dec., then on “come on, let’s try” hop back. Children continue to follow me doing the country dance as they get some great exercise too. When I sing “twelve months in every year” they can spin around like I do or they can hold arms with a friend and turn around.
    It’s easy to follow my dance moves and sing along. Research studies show that singing words to a simple melody can really help those words stay in your memory (like the alphabet song). So, your children will really remember the twelve months of the year. Months of the year song Jack Hartmann.
  Great for memorizing the months of the year, dance, fitness, following directions and having fun together The Months of the Year Line Dance is a great song to start of the school day and throughout the whole school year. With all the movement, this months of the year song can help energize your class as they learn this important calendar skill while building brain and body connections. 
Developing calendar awareness skills like the months of the year, the days of the week and when special holidays and when seasons occur,  provide a great opportunity for your children to learn math and time management skills. Children will get excited about the upcoming calendar events and  fun activities for each month .

videos.title: Movin' is Cool | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's Movin' is Cool is a fun brain breaks, circle time, action packed music and movement song.  This song will engage your children in movement and getting the wiggles out so they can get back and focus on their academic work. 
  Follow along with Jack and add one body part at a time as a fun brain break activity.  Great for listening comprehension and following a growing pattern.  Movin is Cool Jack Hartmann song. As an extension activity have students add on even more movements or switch up the pattern of movements. Fun Kindergarten song for creative movement.

videos.title: Count by 2's to 100 with Grandma and Grandpa | ASL Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Count by 2's with Grandma and Grandpa on the farm in this American Sign Language version.  Grandma and Grandpa will engage learners with movements from the farm as they count by 2's to make body and brain connections. Count along with Jack Hartmann to 100 by 2's.  Count to 100 by 2's. Exercise and build body and brain connections as you count by 2s to 100 with Grandma and Grandpa in this ASL version. Count by 2's to 100 with Grandma and Grandpa is an original song by Jack Hartmann.
Pamela Mascitto's passion for providing equal access for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing people has led her to become a K-12 sign language interpreter for thirteen years, working at schools both in Hawai'i, where she grew up, and in Texas, where she lives currently. She has a degree in Educational Interpreting from Kapi'olani Community College and has both a National Interpreter Certification from the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (NIC) and a Board for Evaluation of Interpreters Advanced Certification (BEI).

videos.title: Keep On Trying | ASL Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Keep on trying whatever challenges you may face is the message of this Jack Hartmann Keep on Trying song. Whether in school, at home or at play, whenever something gets rough, don't give up! Just keep on trying and you will get there! This song offers proactive ways to help you keep on trying with Jack Hartmann's inspirational music.
Pamela Mascitto's passion for providing equal access for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing people has led her to become a K-12 sign language interpreter for thirteen years, working at schools both in Hawai'i, where she grew up, and in Texas, where she lives currently. She has a degree in Educational Interpreting from Kapi'olani Community College and has both a National Interpreter Certification from the Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf (NIC) and a Board for Evaluation of Interpreters Advanced Certification (BEI).

Jack Hartmann Keep On Trying Song.

videos.title: The Letter A | Alphabet A-Z | Jack Hartmann Alphabet Song
videos.description:
This Jack Hartmann's Alphabet A-Z series for the letter Aa. Learn the Letter A.
Learn that A is a vowel in the alphabet. Learn to recognize the upper and lowercase letter A, how to write the letter A and the short and long vowel sounds that letter A makes.  This series incorporates the modalities of visual, auditory and kinesthetic learning while teaching about each letter. This song engages students to be active learners while learning about each letter to build body and brain connections.  Learn how to form the upper and lowercase A with Jack Hartmann's catchy rhymes. These rhymes are a wonderful mnemonic way to remember letter formation.  Learn the long a sound and  words that begin with the long a sound and words that have the medial long a sound. Learn the short a sound and words that begin with the short a sound and have the medial short a sound.  Let's Learn From A to Z  starting with the letter Aa. Let's Learn from a z with Jack Hartmann's alphabet song for Aa. Learn the letter sounds for the short and long vowel sounds for Aa. ABC song.

videos.title: What Word Makes Sense? | Jack Hartmann Rhyming Words | Cloze Method
videos.description:
What Word Makes Sense? This Jack Hartmann video What Word Makes Sense? uses the cloze method to ask students to predict the missing word.  What Word Makes Sense engages students in listening comprehension utilizing context cues and rhyming words.  What Word Makes Sense engages students in active learning and participation while building body and brain connections.
Cloze sentences are sentences in which keywords are deleted, covered up or blocked out. When presented with cloze sentences, students must use context clues to determine the missing word. Cloze sentences are also an engaging way to reinforce vocabulary and  language skills.


What Word Makes Sense?
Everybody sing a little country song
All about the animals on the farm
When I leave out a word just do your best
And sing out loud what word makes sense
That's right
There's a pig whose name is Bud
He rolls and plays right in the ___________.
mud
There's a cow whose name is Sue
She eats the grass and when says ___________.
moo
There's a horse that loves to play
When in the barn she eats her ___________.
hay
There's some ducks out in the back
They waddle to me and then say __________.
quack
 Everybody sing a little country song
All about the animals on the farm
When I leave out a word just do your best
And sing out loud what word makes sense
I see a bunny whose ears just flop
He eats carrots and loves to _________.
hop
I see a little skunk run quick as a wink
Just hold your nose sometimes they __________.
stink
I see a dog drink from a pail
When he's real happy he wags his _________.
tail
Thee sheep are now so big and full
That Farmer John can sheer their __________.
wool
Everybody sing a little country song
All about the animals on the farm
When I leave out a word just do your best
And sing out loud what word makes sense

videos.title: Crossover | Brain Breaks | Crossing the Midline | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's original song Crossover is a fun Brain break song that is all about cross lateral movements. Cross lateral movements are movements that cross the midline of the brain.The midline is an imaginary line that runs down the middle of the body from head to toes, dividing the body into right and left halves. When children do cross - lateral movements the two sides of the brain are forced to communicate and strengthen the brain pathways. Brain Breaks  should be fun and movement oriented. My brain breaks song Crossover,  also gets children to immediately use their brain to concentrate and use different parts of their body to cross the midline. Crossing the midline activities promote communication between the two hemispheres of the brain.  

Crossover tells children exactly what part of the body to crossover from right to left and left to right. Crossover is very easy for children of all ages to do in the regular classroom and at PE.

Crossing the midline is necessary for reading and writing as we go left to right. When we engage children in crossover movements blood flow is increased in all parts of the brain making it more alert and energized for optimal learning.

Use this song as a great musical brain breaks activity for stimulating the brain and body.

LYRICS:
Crossover
Words and Music by Jack Hartmann, MA  BMI  Copyright 2008

Left hand to your right

Crossover will build your body and brain

Crossover will build your body and brain

Learn the days of the week in Rock n' Roll Days of the Week, an original song by Jack Hartmann.  Rock n’ Roll Days of the Week by Jack Hartmann will have students rockin’ and rollin’ as they learn  and dance to the days of the week. This is the perfect math song for an energetic calendar time lesson that engages body and brain connections as students learn the days of the week in this original Jack Hartmann video, Rock n' Roll Days of the Week will have students  learning calendar skills while actively engaging learners in this days of the week song. Learn there are 7 days of the week as you sing and learn the names of the days of the week in this calendar song for kids. Days of the week song for kindergarten.

videos.title: Is It Heavy or Light? | Jack Hartmann Measurement Song
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's Heavy or Light teaches the measurement concept of heavy and light.
Compare heavy things to light things in this heavy or light video.  Build body and brain connections as students are asked to demonstrate with movements to demonstrate if something is heavy or light.  Learn that heavy and light are opposites. Act out heavy and light concepts when given a specific object. Learn Heavy and light are standards of measurement.

Heavy, heavy a dumbbell is heavy
Light, light a paper is light
Heavy, heavy a chair is heavy
Light, light a pencil is light
Heavy, heavy a chair is heavy
Light, light a pencil is light
Come on along and sing this song
And you can get it right
What is heavy?
And what is light?
If I say something that's heavy move around like it's heavy
And If I say something that's light move around like it's light
An elephant is heavy
A balloon is light
A bowling ball is heavy
A tennis ball is light
Heavy, heavy a dumbbell is heavy
Light, light a paper is light
Heavy, heavy a chair is heavy
Light, light a pencil is light
An apple is light
A big pumpkin is heavy
A big monster truck is heavy
A spoon is light
Heavy, heavy a dumbbell is heavy
Light, light a paper is light
Heavy, heavy a chair is heavy
Light, light a pencil is light

videos.title: The Secret Stories® Better Alphabet™ Lite Version | Jack Hartmann & Katie Garner Alphabet Song
videos.description:
Learn the alphabet letters and sounds fast with this “twist” on the original Secret Stories® Better Alphabet™ Song, featuring Jack Hartmann and Katie Garner (author of Secret Stories® Cracking the Reading/Phonics Code with the Brain in Mind!) To learn more Secret Stories®, visit https://www.TheSecretStories.com and subscribe to the Secret Stories® YouTube Channel https://www.youtube.com/user/TheSecretStoriesVids?sub_confirmation=1

The Better Alphabet™ Song uses muscle memory and creative movement to fast-track learning and strengthen sound/symbol connections in the brain for reading and writing!  Learning the long and short vowel sounds is easy when you know the “secrets” about the Superhero Vowels® and their “short and lazy” disguises, and so is remembering all THREE sounds for Sneaky Y®!

The Secret Stories® are easy to remember, brain-based phonics stories that explain the sounds letters make when they get together, with pictures to help kids remember for easy reading and writing! When kids know the individual letter sounds AND the "secret" sounds that letters make when they get together, they can read and write ANYTHING!  Secret Stories phonics is a learning letter sound, phonics song. This abc song will have student's learning the secret stories associated with letters and their sounds. Secret Stories Better Alphabet Song is a fun, engaging way to build body and brain connections.


For more Secrets to help your child learn to read,  join the new Secret Stories® Facebook Group at https://bit.ly/SSFBgroup or visit https://www.TheSecretStories.com​. You can also download the iOS app https://apple.co/3veks38.

videos.title: Daytime and Nighttime | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Daytime and Nighttime by Jack Hartmann introduces the concept of night and day. This interactive teaching tool will engage students in active learning participation as they choose between daytime and nighttime activities. Lessons about the sun can include information about how it affects light and darkness, as well as human and animal activity. Learning about nighttime and daytime works as a precursor to introducing students to calendars and other methods of tracking time.

In Daytime and Nighttime students learn to understand the concept of night and day and recognize the pattern of the day and night cycle.  By listing out the activities that they perform in the daytime and at night, students learn that their daily activities follow the day and night cycle. The concept  of daytime and nighttime is reinforced by the visual representation of day and night using the sun and moon. 
The priority is to get students noticing and describing what objects in the sky look like at different times in the daytime sky and night sky.
Daytime and Nighttime by Jack Hartmann encourages students classify daytime or nighttime activities, to  observe and describe what the sky looks like at different times; to identify objects in the sky and recognize changes over time; to look for objects that are common to the daytime and nighttime sky.

Lyrics
Daytime and Nighttime by Jack Hartmann
Everybody listen to what I say
Then you think, and tell me if it's in the daytime or nighttime
When does the sun rise?
In the daytime
When does a rooster crow?
In the daytime
When do the owls hoot?
In the nighttime
When do the stars shine bright?
In the nighttime
Daytime is when the sky is light
Nighttime is when the sky is dark
When does the mailman come?

When does the moon shine bright?
In the nighttime

In the nighttime
When can you see fireworks?

In the daytime

videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's original song, Make Straight Lines is an interactive video for pre writing skills.
Practice Straight Lines will have students practicing straight lines vertically, horizontally and across.
Students will practice making slanted lines in both directions as they practice straight lines and get ready to write. Practicing straight lines, vertical lines and horizontal lines are prewriting strategies.

Let's learn how to do it one line at a time

videos.title: Count by 10's Together | ASL Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Count by 10's and exercise with Jack Hartmann in this ASL video, Count by 10s Together.  Build your body and brain with this count by 10s video. Count by 10's to 100 and build your brain and body. Counting by 10s song. Count by tens as you exercise and build brain and body connections. Build your brain and body and count by 10's in this Jack Hartmann counting song.

Patrick “Mr. Shineyhead” Fischer, CDI (Certified Deaf Interpreter), is from several generations of fine artists and performers from Germany and has extensive experience in all things related to theatre and art. Patrick has been involved in a variety of artistic positions (artist, performer, director, producer, teacher, Director of Artistic Sign Language, and consultant) as well as participation in a variety of performances (storytelling, acting, and comedy) internationally. 

Patrick launched his business in 2005 as a way to provide services to those who want to learn more about theatre through deaf eyes. When not "working" in theatre he taught American Sign Language and deaf studies/deaf history, and currently is a certified ASLTA Master instructor.  He has taught under the Sign Language Studies Program and Sign Language Interpretation Program in Portland, Oregon.  Also, Patrick is a Deaf Language Model in Alaska. Patrick has his Graphic Design degree, and he is also an awarded professional artist and co-owner/marketing designer of the firm, Expert Business Support, Inc. Patrick now resides in Connecticut.

To know more about Patrick “Mr. Shineyhead” Fischer, check out his website and YouTube:

Patrick “Mr. Shineyhead” Fischer, CDI (Certified Deaf Interpreter), is from several generations of fine artists and performers from Germany and has extensive experience in all things related to theatre and art. Patrick has been involved in a variety of artistic positions (artist, performer, director, producer, teacher, Director of Artistic Sign Language, and consultant) as well as participation in a variety of performances (storytelling, acting, and comedy) internationally. 

Patrick launched his business in 2005 as a way to provide services to those who want to learn more about theatre through deaf eyes. When not "working" in theatre he taught American Sign Language and deaf studies/deaf history, and currently is a certified ASLTA Master instructor.  He has taught under the Sign Language Studies Program and Sign Language Interpretation Program in Portland, Oregon.  Also, Patrick is a Deaf Language Model in Alaska. Patrick has his Graphic Design degree, and he is also an awarded professional artist and co-owner/marketing designer of the firm, Expert Business Support, Inc. Patrick now resides in Connecticut.

To know more about Patrick “Mr. Shineyhead” Fischer, check out his website and YouTube:

videos.title: Parts of a Book | Pre-K Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Parts of a Book by Jack Hartmann teaches about all the important parts of a book.
Learn about the front cover, back cover, title page and spine of a book. Learn about what  important elements are on each of these parts of a book.  Learn the front cover shows a picture about the book and has the author, illustrator and publisher names. Learn the back cover protects the back of the book and may have a picture of the illustrator and an explanation of what the book is about.
Learn the title page show the title, author, illustrator and publishers name again. Learn the spine of a book holds the pages of a book together.  Enjoy reading and learning about the parts of a book in this Jack Hartmann parts of a book song.

videos.title: Great Way to Start the Day | Jack Hartmann Start the Day Song | Kids Stretching Song
videos.description:
Start the day out right by stretching your brain and body in  Great Way to Start the Day by Jack Hartmann.  Stretch your way into the day and get oxygen out to your body and brain.  
Our brain needs oxygen and water for optimum brain functioning. To help our brains be their best, what do we need to do?  Have good water intake, deep breathing and movement for learning our best. Getting adequate oxygen to the brain is a critical component of brain development. To help our brains be their best, what do we need to do? Drink lots of water and breathe efficiently. Pretty simple, right?
 One of the most efficient and effective ways for stimulating brain function is breathing. Get moving in this brain breaks, stretching and breathing song with Jack Hartmann. 

Lyrics
Great Way to Start the Day!
Get your eyes ready to see so much
Get your heart ready to give some love
Get your hands ready to help someone

videos.title: Count by 10's From Any Number | Single Digits | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Count by 10's From Any Number by Jack Hartmann demonstrates how to add on 10 to a single digit number.  Count by 10s From Any Number shows how to add a 1 to the tens column in order to add on 10 more from the given number.  The first time through Count by 10's From Any Number 10 is added on to single digit numbers in order from 1 through 9. The second time through Count by 10's From Any Number, Jack Hartmann gives students a challenge and mixes the numbers up for higher order comprehension.

videos.title: Spanish Vowel Sounds with Jack | Jack Hartmann | Los Sonidos de las Vocales
videos.description:
Spanish Vowel Sounds with Jack teaches the Spanish vowels and their sound.  Join Jack Hartmann and Miss Sonya as they teach that Spanish vowels are the same vowels as English language vowels but they have completely different sounds in Spanish.  Learn the vowel sound each Spanish vowel makes and learn that Spanish vowels sound the same every time they are used.  Learn the names of the Spanish objects that begin with each Spanish vowel sound in this Jack Hartmann Spanish Vowel Sounds video.  Spanish vowels song by Jack Hartmann


Hola Jack, aprendamos Las vocales!
Yeah!  Let's sing together and learn!
AEIOU
The vowels will help us read, it's really true
AEIOU
They always sound the same every time they're used
A   A  A  araña
E   E   E  elefante
I  I  I    iguana
O  O  O  oso
U  U  U  unicornio
That was fun learning our vowel sounds in Spanish

See It, Say It, Sign It Volume 2  teaches sign language for each letter and the letter sounds for each letter of the alphabet with American Sign Language in this Jack Hartmann video, See It Say It Sign It Volume 2 .   Jack shows the sign for each letter and the letter sounds for each letter as he sings the letter name and the letter is shown on the screen. This version also includes the letter sounds and objects beginning with the letter sound.  We have added new words for each letter of the alphabet in this See It, Say It, Sign It Volume 2 version.  This is a simple and fun way to learn sign language for each letter of the alphabet.  As a fun follow up challenge have each student spell their name using signs for each letter.  ASL alphabet.

videos.title: When Two Vowels Go Walking | Jack Hartmann Vowel Teams Song | Vowels Song
videos.description:
When Two Vowels Go Walking sometimes the first one does the talking by having the first vowel as the long vowel sound and the second vowel is silent.  This catchy song will help students remember when 2 Vowels Go Walking sometimes the first one does the talking. This Jack Hartmann vowel song demonstrates the 2 vowels go walking rule by giving examples of each set
of vowels used with a second silent vowel.  When 2 Vowels Go Walking teaches how vowel teams work together.

The first one does the talking
The second vowel you see but you don't say

They walk together in words like this

When you say the word rain, you  hear the a vowel sound
rain, rain, rain

When you say the word beat, you only hear the e vowel sound

videos.title: One Hour of Jack Hartmann Rest Time Songs | Rest Time Songs | Jack Hartmann | Calm Music
videos.description:
Jack Hartmann's One Hour of Rest Time Songs is an hour of beautiful, relaxing lullabies and rest time songs for children.  Listen to individual songs or listen for the entire hour of lullaby songs to help your children relax, feel calm and be inspired.  Jack Hartmann created these songs to enjoy while starting the day or at rest time to help children feel safe, secure and peaceful. Another great way to use these songs are as brain breaks to enhance future learning.  When children feel calm it enhances their concentration and focus and allows them to assimilate lessons of the day before other learning takes place.  This collection of Jack Hartmann's calming songs, has beautiful melodies and a diversity of smooth and easy listening words and beautiful vocals.  Some of the topics included in this rest time collection are:
Kindness
Self- Esteem
Family
Following Your Dreams
The Importance of Resting Your Body and Brain
ABC's
Humpty Dumpty Lullabies

Enjoy listening to Jack Hartmann's calm music as a peaceful brain break and energize your body and brain to enhance further learning each day.

videos.title: Shape Up! | Jack Hartmann | Shapes Song
videos.description:
Shape Up by Jack Hartmann is about 2 dimensional shapes. Identify shapes and their attributes in this shape song by Jack Hartmann.  Learn about the following shapes; circle, square, triangle, rectangle, oval and rhombus.  Make each shape in the air as you engage body and brains while you learn about shapes in this shapes song. 2d shapes for kids.

Square
Triangle
Rectangle
Oval
Rhombus

Put your arms out front
Circle round and round

Feel your muscles pump
Use your legs and arms
Everyone shape up
Now let's make shapes all together

Follow me and move your body
Let's shape up

Go round like the sun
Go round like a ball

We made a circle

We made a square

We made a triangle
Rectangle

Two short and two long
Oval

videos.title: You Go! | Jack Hartmann |  Motivation Song for Kids
videos.description:
You Go! by Jack Hartmann is a motivational song and motivational video for kids. You Go! is a self esteem song for kids to realize their dreams and achieve their goals. With the support of others and the strength from within to work hard, put the time in and focus on your goals you will go. You Go!  Keep Trying always believe in yourself and one day you'll be flying.  Thank you so much for all the pictures that were sent in by families showing kids believing and achieving!  There were so many touching pictures and we enjoyed each and everyone!  I wish we could have used them all but they sure made us realize how so many of you are like Kylie Jo and keep trying and flying!  You Go! is a social skills song about determination and self esteem for kids. Hold your head up high and keep trying!


You Go!
I see you’ve got your mind set, your body ready
You know it’s up to you
You got some dreams waiting
You know the way to make them all come true
When people say you can’t let that make you try harder
Keep that fire burning in your soul
You Go, don’t stop
You’ve got what it takes to make it to the top
You Go, keep trying               
Always believe in yourself and one day you’ll be flying
Have courage, be strong, have hope
You go, you go!
I feel you’ve got a good plan to make your stand
Work hard at it every day
And if you fall down, or get lost
You search and find a better way
When sometimes it gets rough and you want to give up
Hear those words pounding in your heart
You Go, don’t stop
You’ve got what it takes to make it to the top
You Go, keep trying               
Always believe in yourself and one day you’ll be flying
Have courage, be strong, have hope
You go, you go!
You go, go go, you got it

You go, go, go, you believe it
You go, go, go, you’ll achieve it



You Go, don’t stop

videos.title: On This Day | Jack Hartmann | Positive Actions
videos.description:
On This Day by Jack Hartmann is a wonderful way to start the day with positive messages of building your body and brain and doing your best to be the best you can be.
On This day has positive messages of being a friend, building positive self esteem, whole body listening skills and showing respect. On This Day by Jack Hartmann incorporates all these positive actions while building body and brains and body and brain connections through active learning and participation. This brain breaks song will allow students to start the day with positive messages and positive actions directed to themselves and others. Positive affirmations are a wonderful way to reinforce positive thinking. Great for morning routines and starting the day with a positive attitude .

videos.description:
Sign the Colors by Jack Hartmann introduces the American Sign Language sign for each color.
Learn ASL for the colors: red, blue, yellow, green purple and orange.  Find out what Jack Hartmann's favorite color is at the end of the video.  Learn sign language for beginners in this ASL colors video.   Make a graph showing each students choice and compare and contrast the choices for a fun math lesson.
As an extension activity ask students their favorite color in the video and have them sign the color.
Which color has more?
Which color has less?
How many more votes does the favorite color have than the least?
Stay tuned for part 2 where Jack Hartmann will introduce and sign other colors.

videos.title: Tall and Short | Jack Hartmann | Measurement Song
videos.description:
Tall or Short by Jack Hartmann introduces the concept of height and compares tall and short objects.
Jack Hartmann gives real life examples of tall and short and then students are asked to apply this skill when answering the next part of the video if an object is tall or short.
Jack reinforces their answer with the correct response. This measurement song compares tall and short. The concept of opposites can also be applied to tall and short in this measurement for kids song. Tall and short song for kindergarten. Measurement for kindergarten.

It means how tall or short something is

It means how tall or short something is

A monkey is short

videos.title: Sign the Colors 2 | Jack Hartmann | ASL Colors
videos.description:
Sign the Colors 2 by Jack Hartmann introduces the American Sign Language sign for colors.
Learn ASL for the colors: pink, black, yellow, White, brown, grey and tan. 
 Learn sign language for beginners in this ASL colors video. 
As an extension activity ask students their favorite color in the video and have them sign the color.
  Make a graph showing each students choice of their favorite color in the video and compare and contrast the choices for a fun math lesson.
Which color has more?
Which color has less?

Students will clap up high for one syllable words, clap left to right for two syllable words and clap high, in the middle and low for 3 syllable words. It's fun learning syllables as you stand up and clap out the syllables with Jack Hartmann.

videos.title: Jump Out Words!  | Jack Hartmann Sight Words
videos.description:
Jump Out Words by Jack Hartmann explains that jump out words are sight words that show up in reading material with high frequency.
This cool Latin beat song on sight words can really help children to learn, memorize and spell many of these high frequency words. When children know them by sight, it helps them read with more fluency and ease.
Sight words should be words that children don't need to sound out with phonics, they just know the words and continue reading. Knowing jump out words or sight words promotes reading fluency. Students read fluently when they don't have to stop and sound out words, they can just identify the jump out word by sight.
I thought of the phrase jump out words because when children see them they just jump out in their mind that they know this high frequency word. This version of Jump Out Words has Jack spelling and saying the jump out word twice as students repeat  the jump out word each time.
This song will have children having fun as they learn these sight words!

Jump Out Words

Jump out words, when I see them
Jump out words, I know them         
Jump out words, when I see them
Jump out words, I know them

When I read from left to right
Some words just jump out in my mind
They help me read really cool
They help me read nice and smooth

Let's learn some jump out words right now
And work our body out
Roll your arms like a wheel and repeat after me

t-h-e      the                    ( 4 x each word)
a-n-d     and
y-o-u     you
o-f           of
t-o           to
i-t           it

Jump out words, when I see them
Jump out words, I know them         
Jump out words, when I see them
Jump out words, I know them

Shake, shake your hips and repeat after me

f-o-r    for
a-r-e   are
b-e      be
w-a-s  was
a-s      as
a-t       at

Jump out words, when I see them
Jump out words, I know them         
Jump out words, when I see them
Jump out words, I know them
Jump out words, when I see them
Jump out words, I know them

videos.title: Addition and Subtraction | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Addition and Subtraction by Jack Hartmann introduces  the operations of addition and subtraction.
Addition is adding 2 or more number and getting a greater number or sum. Subtraction is taking away to get the difference. Jack Hartmann introduces simple addition and subtraction word problems to show each operation. There is a special rule at the end for adding and subtracting zero to a number in this Addition and Subtraction video by Jack Hartmann.  Addition and subtraction word problems.  

Addition and Subtraction Lyrics

When you add you put together
When you add you get the sum
It's taking 2 or more numbers and getting a greater one
Adding is called addition
When you subtract you take away
When you subtract you get the difference
It's taking one number from another and always getting less
Subtracting is called subtraction
Let's try an adding problem I think you can solve
If you have 3 pencils,     3
And you add 2 more pencils    2
How many pencils do you have all together?
3 + 2 = 5
Let's try another adding problem, I think you can get it
If you have 2 dogs          2
And you add 2 more dogs      2
How many dogs do you have all together
1,2,3,4
2 + 2= 4
Let's try a subtracting problem I think you can solve
If you have 4 balls     4
And you subtract 2 balls     2
How many balls do you have left?
1,2
4 - 2 = 2
 Let's try another subtracting problem
Think, you can do it
If you have 6 apples     6
And you subtract 3 apples     3
How many apples  do you have left?
1,2,3
6 - 3 = 3
Now listen to this cool rule about number 0
When you add or subtract  0 the number doesn't change
When you add or subtract 0 the number stays the same
When you add you put together
When you add you get the sum
It's taking 2 or more numbers and getting a greater one
Adding is called addition
When you subtract you take away
When you subtract you get the difference
It's taking one number from another and always getting less
Subtracting is called subtraction

   This cool Latin beat song on sight words can really help children to learn, memorize and spell many of these high frequency words. When children know them by sight, it helps them read with more fluency and ease.
Sight words should be words that children don't need to sound out with phonics, they just know the words and continue reading. Knowing jump out words or sight words promotes reading fluency. Students read fluently when they don't have to stop and sound out words, they can just identify the jump out word by sight.
I thought of the phrase jump out words because when children see them they just jump out in their mind that they know this high frequency word. This version of Jump Out Words has Jack spelling and saying the jump out word twice as students repeat  the jump out word each time.
This song will have children having fun as they learn these sight words!

videos.description:
I Have 5 Senses Sight by Jack Hartmann is a 5 senses song about the sense of sight.  Learn the sense of sight allows us to see so many things each day. Our sense of sight helps us to learn and read books.  Our sense of sight allows us to gather information for our brain to use.  

I Have 5 Senses - Sight Lyrics

I have 5 senses I use everyday
I have 5 senses I use in so many ways
Every day I try with all my might
So many times I use the sense of sight
With my eyes I see the sun shining bright in the sky
With my eyes I see a friend give me a happy smile
With my eyes I see the words and pictures in a book
With my eyes I see beauty everywhere I look
Everyday I try with all my might
So many times I use the sense of sight
I have 5 senses I use everyday
I have 5 senses I use in so many ways
Every day I try with all my might
So many times I use the sense of sight
My 5 senses are the tools I can use
To gather information for my brain to use
They help me learn and grow and be the best I can be
My 5 senses are so good to me
I have 5 senses I use everyday
I have 5 senses I use in so many ways
Every day I try with all my might
So many times I use the sense of sight
See, smell, taste, hear and touch
With my 5 senses I learn so much
See, smell, taste, hear and touch
With my 5 senses I learn so much

videos.title: I Have 5 Senses | Hearing | Jack Hartmann Sense of Hearing
videos.description:
I Have 5 Senses Hearing by Jack Hartmann is a 5 senses song about the sense of hearing.  Learn the sense of hearing allows us to hear so many things all around us each day. Our sense of hearing helps us to learn about the world around us.  Our sense of hearing allows us to gather information for our brain to use.  Learn that when something makes a sound it makes vibrations that cause the sound waves to go in our ears.  Sense of hearing by Jack Hartmann teaches that our sense of hearing is a very important part of our five senses.


I Have 5 Senses - Hearing Lyrics

I have 5 senses
I use everyday
I have 5 senses I use in so many ways 
Every day I hear so many things 
So many times I use the sense of hearing
With my ears I hear the birds singing their song
With my ears I hear bells go bing, bing, bong    
With my ears I hear a train go choo, choo, choo 
With my ears I love to hear I love you
Every day I hear so many things
So many times I use the sense of hearing
My 5 senses are the tools I can use
To gather information for my brain to use
They help me learn and grow and be the best I can be
My 5 senses are so good to me
With my ears I hear the birds singing their song
With my ears I hear bells go bing, bing, bong    
With my ears I hear a train go choo, choo, choo

So many times I use the sense of hearing
I have 5 senses
I use everyday
I have 5 senses
I use in so many ways

 it vibrates or shakes the air all around

videos.description:
I Have 5 Senses Touch by Jack Hartmann is a 5 senses song about the sense of touch.  Learn the sense of touch allows us to feel so many things all around us each day. Our sense of touch helps us to learn about the world around us.  Our sense of touch allows us to gather information for our brain to use.  Sense of touch by Jack Hartmann teaches that our sense of touch is a very important part of our five senses.

I use everyday

I use in so many ways 
Every day I can learn so much
So many times I use the sense of touch
With my hands I feel the water when it's flowing down
With my feet I feel the ground as I walk around   
With my skin I feel hurt if I get bit by a bug
With my arms I feel love when I get a hug 
Every day I can learn so much
So many times I use the sense of touch
My 5 senses are the tools I can use
To gather information for my brain to use
They help me learn and grow and be the best I can be

With my sense of touch I feel things with my skin

videos.title: Signing All Over the World | Jack Hartmann ASL Alphabet Song
videos.description:
Signing All Over the World by Jack Hartmann teaches the ASL alphabet and the sign for each word starting with each letter of the alphabet in this alphabet song. Sing along with Jack and follow the signs for each letter and word in this ASL alphabet song. 
Patrick “Mr. Shineyhead” Fischer, CDI (Certified Deaf Interpreter), is from several generations of fine artists and performers from Germany and has extensive experience in all things related to theatre and art. Patrick has been involved in a variety of artistic positions (artist, performer, director, producer, teacher, Director of Artistic Sign Language, and consultant) as well as participation in a variety of performances (storytelling, acting, and comedy) internationally. 

Patrick launched his business in 2005 as a way to provide services to those who want to learn more about theatre through deaf eyes. When not "working" in theatre he taught American Sign Language and deaf studies/deaf history, and currently is a certified ASLTA Master instructor.  He has taught under the Sign Language Studies Program and Sign Language Interpretation Program in Portland, Oregon.  Also, Patrick is a Deaf Language Model in Alaska. Patrick has his Graphic Design degree, and he is also an awarded professional artist and co-owner/marketing designer of the firm, Expert Business Support, Inc. Patrick now resides in Connecticut.



Signing All Over the World copyright © 2021 by Jack Hartmann

videos.title: New ABC Lullaby | Jack Hartmann Alphabet Song
videos.description:
New ABC Lullaby by Jack Hartmann is a slower paced alphabet song that separates the letters in a new way in order to emphasize individual letters.  The letters are separated and grouped differently from the standard alphabet song. This version does not group l,m,n,o,p together to avoid the letters running together and sounding like one letter.  The first time through lower case letters are presented. The second time through Upper Case letters are presented. The final time both the Upper and lower case letters are shown together in this ABC song for kids.

videos.title: The Letter Sound Challenge | Letter Runs | Jack Hartmann and Katie Garner
videos.description:
The Letter Sound Challenge is a challenge to say the letter sounds ,or phonemes, independently in isolation from saying the letter name. This Letter Sound Challenge increases speed each of the three times Jack Hartmann says the sounds.  Sing along with Jack in this phonics song. 
The Secret Stories® Letter Run Song Challenge
How well do you know the sounds of the letters in the alphabet? Build you reading power by singing them fast with the Secret Stories® "Letter Run” Challenge, featuring Jack Hartmann and Katie Garner (author of Secret Stories® Cracking the Reading/Phonics Code with the Brain in Mind!). For more Secrets to help your child learn to read,  join the new Secret Stories® Facebook Group at https://bit.ly/SSFBgroup or visit https://www.TheSecretStories.com​. You can also download the iOS app https://apple.co/3veks38.
 SECRET STORIES® LETTER RUN
The Secret Stories® Letter Runs are the perfect way to help kids build speed and stamina for reading and writing. By skipping the letter names and focusing only on their sounds,  the Letter Runs mimic the decoding process that occurs when reading words—which is to "see the letter and make the sound” as quickly as possible. The rapid pace also helps to increase automaticity of sound-symbol relationships, crucial to both reading and writing. But knowing the individual letter sounds is just HALF the battle. The other half is knowing the sounds letters make when they get together and DON'T do what they should! These are the “secret” sounds of the phonics code, known as Secret Stories®.
Secret Stories® are easy to remember, brain-based phonics stories that explain the sounds letters make when they get together, with pictures to help kids remember for reading and writing. When kids know the individual letter sounds AND their "secret” phonics sounds, they can read and write ANYTHING! Learn more at https://www.TheSecretStories.com and subscribe to the Secret Stories® YouTube Channel for more phonics fun! https://bit.ly/3aFSd5G

videos.title: Make a Rhyme, Make a Move | Rhyming Words | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Make a Rhyme, Make a Move  by Jack Hartmann helps develop rhyming skills and phonological awareness (hearing the parts in words). This  rhyming song  engages your children with movement, dance, and most importantly an opportunity to practice their awareness of words that rhyme. This song really makes rhyming fun which is so important in learning for young children. The ability to know when words rhyme is an essential listening and language skill for all children.  Many studies have shown that children who have developed their ability to know when words rhyme will have a better chance of becoming successful readers. Offering your children many opportunities to hear and practice rhyming will give them a better chance of becoming lifelong readers.
Make a Rhyme, Make a Move is a great song to use regularly to allow your children to really have   fun learning about rhyming.  This song presents two words, and children have a chance to listen and decide if the words rhyme or not. If the words rhyme then they do a cool Hip –Hop dance, and if the words don’t rhyme they get a chance to move and say - No way, no way.
 Listening for the parts of sounds in words at the beginning, middle and ending really helps children develop their phonological awareness (hearing the parts of words) skills so important in becoming a successful reader.
Make a Rhyme, Make a Move will really help make learning about rhyming fun for all your children.
 Make a Rhyme, Make a Move includes Jack Hartmann and Rachel Smith singing together. Both Rachel and Jack show your children the different moves and dances they can do. And, this rhyming song features rhyming that is simple and easy to follow. Students are actively engaged in learning as they decide if the words rhyme or don't rhyme.
Studies show that having the ability to recognize and be aware of words that rhyme is a good predictor of future successful reading in the future.
Help make rhyming fun for your children and sing, dance and listen for those rhymes! 

Make a Rhyme, Make a Move Lyrics copyright© by Jack Hartmann

Learn the sight word very in I Love Learning Sight Words by Jack Hartmann.  Learn about the sight word very by spelling the word very with Jack, spelling the word very independently and listening to the sight word very used in sentences.  Sight words are  high frequency words that students learn to recognize by sight instead of having to de-code or sound out the the word.  Learning sight words contributes to reading fluency and comprehension.  Learn the sight word very in this sight word song. Jack Hartmann sight words song.

videos.title: Old MacDonald | Real Animals | Jack Hartmann | Farm Animals Song
videos.description:
Old MacDonald by Jack Hartmann shows Jack on the farm with real animals.  See the real animals and hear the real animal sounds each animal makes.  Jack sings the Old favorite, Old MacDonald with beautiful scenery from real farms in our area. Join Jack and Old MacDonald as they visit cows, pigs, horses, sheep, chickens, goats, donkey and bees.  Sing along to Old MacDonald had a farm and join Jack and Old MacDonald on  their authentic farm visits. Sing along and learn about farm animals on this farm animals song.

Hey Girls and Boy we're out here on Old MacDonald's Farm
Let's meet all the farm animals and sing one of our favorite songs
Old MacDonald had a farm 
Ee i ee i o
And on that farm he had some cows
Ee i ee i oh

And a moo moo there
Here a moo, there a moo
Everywhere a moo moo

Ee i ee i o
And on that farm he had some pigs

Everywhere an oink, oink

Ee i ee i o

Ee i ee i o
With a neigh, neigh here
And a neigh, neigh there
Here a neigh
There a neigh
Everywhere a neigh, neigh

Ee i ee i o
And on that farm he had some sheep
Ee i ee i o

Ee i ee i o

Everywhere a maa, maa

And a hee-haw there
Here a hee
There a haw
Everywhere a hee- haw

Ee i ee i o
And on that farm he had some ducks
Ee i ee i o

Here a quack

Everywhere a quack, quack

videos.title: Count to 100 in Spanish | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Count to 100 in Spanish by Jack Hartmann.  Learn to count to from 1 – 100 in Spanish.   This is a great counting in Spanish by 1’s song.   The song's great beat and steady counting allow you to get the visual number recognition and the pronunciation of the number in Spanish. We leave enough room after the number for repeating the number. You can work your way up to saying the number along with us.  This counting in Spanish by 1’s song will engage Spanish learners with the catchy upbeat music and the clear numeral visuals.

videos.title: The Olympic Games  | The Olympics for Kids  | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Olympic Games by Jack Hartmann is about the history and spirit of The Olympic Games. Learn the Olympic Games started in Greece.  Follow along with Jack's movements as he captures the pride and commitment of the athletes coming together for their countries . Learn the  Olympic Symbol has five colored rings.  Celebrate The Olympic Games with this Olympic song for kids.
Olympics for kids video.

videos.title: Follow a Dream | Olympic Song | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Follow a Dream by Jack Hartmann is dedicated to the athletes of the Olympic Games who through hard work and dedication have followed their dreams of becoming Olympic athletes. Celebrate the spirit of the Olympic Games in this song by Jack Hartmann.  This song is dedicated to peace, love and the power of human achievement.


Follow A Dream Lyrics

We have come together from all around
The east and the west, the north and the south
We are different yet we're the same
With a dream in our heart we are on our way
With a dream in our heart we are on our way
See the colors shining, see the hands waving proud
It's a wonderful feeling we're feeling right now
All the work we've done, all the love it takes
Raise your hands up high
Celebrate, celebrate the Olympic games
That's where we'll play, that's where we'll run
That's where we'll celebrate under the sun
People together, the whole world to see
People together to follow a dream
We have come together to play in peace
Trying to be the best we can be
We are all different, yet we're the same
With a dream in our heart we are on our way
With a dream in our heart we are on our way
See the colors shining, see the hands waving proud
It's a wonderful feeling we're feeling right now
All the work we've done, all the love it takes
Raise your hands up high
Celebrate, celebrate The Olympic Games
That's where we'll play, that's where we'll run
That's where we'll celebrate under the sun
People together, the whole world to see
People together to follow a dream
Everybody sing
That's where we'll play, that's where we'll run
That's where we'll celebrate under the sun
People together, the whole world to see
People together to follow a dream
Follow, follow, follow a dream

videos.description:
Dolch Sight Word Review by Jack Hartmann teaches the first ten sight words on the Dolch Sight Word List.  Try to say the sight word before Jack does the first two times through. The third time through the list read the sight word independently.   Dolch Sight Word Review 1-10 goes through the first 10 sight words twice with Jack and once independently.  The first ten Dolch sight words are: the, to, and, he, a, I, you, it, of and in.

Learning the Alphabet by Jack Hartmann is an alphabet recognition, letter sound and beginning letter song.  For each letter learn the letter name, word with the beginning sound for each letter and the letter sound in isolation.  This Learning the Alphabet Zed version is for our international friends.
 As a fun extension activity have students name other words with each beginning sound. Learning the Alphabet is a great way to learn each letter and their phonemes.

videos.title: Let's Dance and Sing the ABCs | Traditional | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Let's Dance and Sing the ABC's by Jack Hartmann has you dancing through the alphabet to build body and brain connections. This version is the traditional alphabet song pacing.  The first time through the alphabet you will disco dance through the lower case letters.  Do the chicken dance as you dance and sing the upper case letters. You will swim your way through the upper and lower case letters presented together in this abc song for kids. Jack has developed three videos with different pacing for learning the alphabet.  Have your class vote on their favorite version.

videos.title: My 5 Senses | 5 Senses Song | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
My 5 Senses by Jack Hartmann is a song about the five senses.  This five senses song for kids teaches about the sense of smell, taste, touch, hearing and sight.  This song is geared for Pre-K and kindergarten to introduce the 5 senses. This song identifies each of the 5 senses and the body part associated with each sense.

With my two eyes I can see all around
With my two ears lots of sounds
With my ten fingers and my skin I can touch
With my nose I can smell so much
With my tongue I taste the food that I eat

videos.description:
ABC Lullaby by Jack Hartmann is a traditional alphabet song.   This version is the classic, traditional version of singing the ABC's with the letter zed for our international friends.   The first time through lower case letters are presented. The second time through Upper Case letters are presented. The final time both the Upper and lower case letters are shown together in this ABC song for kids.  This is one of a series of three Jack Hartmann ABC lullaby songs.  Have your students listen to all three and give a class vote on which version is their favorite.

videos.title: Let's Learn About the Letter A | Jack Hartmann Alphabet Song
videos.description:
Let's Learn About the Letter A by Jack Hartmann  focuses on the Uppercase  letter A.  Learn how to write the uppercase A. Learn the sound the letter A makes and learn a word that starts with the letter A in this letter A song for kids.  The letter formation in this series follows Dr. Jan Richardson's handwriting directions.

Let's Learn About the the Letter A lyrics
Let's learn
Let's learn
Let's learn about the letters
Let's learn
Let's learn
About the letter A
Let's learn what A looks like
Let's learn what sound it makes
Then we'll write the letter A uppercase
And let's learn a word with A
You can see and say
This is an uppercase A
Slant down
Slant down
Across
Slant down
Slant down
Across
Now you write an uppercase A all on your own
Slant down
Slant down
Across
Slant down
Slant down
Across
Look and listen
And at the end say the letter sound and the word
Letter A says /A/ /A/ Apple
A says /A/ /A/ Apple
A says /A/ /A/ Apple
Let's learn
Let's learn
Let's learn about the letters
Let's learn
Let's learn
About the letter A

videos.title: Count to 100 in Spanish | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Count to 100 in Spanish by Jack Hartmann teaches the Spanish numbers 1 - 100.  Join 
Miss Sonya as she sings the numbers and repeat the Spanish numbers after her.  Have fun counting and singing the Spanish numbers 1 to 100.The song's great beat and steady counting allow you to get the visual number recognition and the pronunciation of the number in Spanish. We leave enough room after the number for repeating the number. You can work your way up to saying the number along with us.  This counting in Spanish by 1’s song will engage Spanish language learners with the catchy upbeat music and the clear numeral visuals.

videos.title: Alliteration is Cool! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Alliteration by Jack Hartmann is an alliteration song that teaches that alliteration is words in a sentence or phrase that have the same beginning sounds.  Sing and move to this fun alliteration song for kids as Jack gives lots of fun examples of alliteration sentences to sing and move to.
As a fun extension activity have students come up with their own fun sentences with alliteration, or have them come up with an alliteration sentence that starts with the same first letter of their name.  Alliteration by Jack Hartmann gives alliteration examples and answers the question what is alliteration?



Alliteration Lyrics
Let's all learn about Alliteration
Alliteration is cool
Alliteration is really fun to do
The beginning sound of the words are the same
It's several words together that you read, write or say
Here's some alliteration words for you
Come on let's sing and move
Allie the alligator chomps apples.
Allie the alligator chomps apples.
Ricky the racoon rides roller coasters.
Ricky the racoon rides roller coasters.
Billy the bunny bounced by the bushes.
Billy the bunny bounced by the bushes.
Keesha Kangaroo cuddles koalas.
Keesha Kangaroo cuddles koalas.
Alliteration is cool
Alliteration is really fun to do
The beginning sound of the words are the same
It's several words together that you read, write or say
Dee Dee the dog dances disco.
Dee Dee the dog dances disco.
Ruby the reindeer runs by the river.
Rudy the reindeer runs by the river.
Dezzie the dolphin dives down deep.
Dezzie the dolphin dives down deep.
Sammy the snake slithers slowly.
Sammy the snake slithers slowly.
Alliteration is repeating the same sound at the beginning of words
In a phrase or a sentence you read or use
Alliteration is cool
Alliteration is cool
Alliteration is really fun to do
The beginning sound of the words are the same
It's several words together that you read, write or say

videos.title: What Do I Want To Be For Halloween? | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
What Do I Want to Be For Halloween?  by Jack Hartmann lets you use your imagination to dream about whatever fun character you want to be. Join Jack during this fun Halloween song for kids and use your own imagination to picture yourself as lots of fun characters.  

What Do I Want to Be For Halloween? Lyrics
I'm so excited
I'm smiling ear to ear
It's the Halloween time of year
Everyday I like being me with my friends
But on Halloween it's fun to pretend
I use my imagination and see
What do I want to be?
I might be an astronaut blasting into space
Then walking on the moon slow motion pace
I might be a dancer dancing in a show
Twirling, swirling, feel the music flow
I might be a superhero flying way up high
Helping lots of people and making them smile
I might be a puppy dog wagging my tail
And flopping my ears walking down the trail
I'm so excited
I'm smiling ear to ear
It's the Halloween time of year
Everyday I like being me with my friends
But on Halloween it's fun to pretend
I use my imagination and see
What do I want to be?
I might be a monster stomping on the ground
And growling with a mighty sound
I might be a surfer saying, "Hey Dude"
Riding on the waves, being really cool
I might be a body builder pumping my muscles up
Getting stronger and stronger and never giving up
I might be a Grandma or Grandpa walking with a cane
With gray hair and glasses and 100 years of age
I wonder, I wonder, what do I want to be
I could be an astronaut
I could be a dancer
I could be a superhero
I could be a puppy dog
I could be a monster
I could be a surfer
I could be a body builder
I could be a Grandma and Grandpa
Now you think quietly
What do you want to be?
I'm so excited
I'm smiling ear to ear
It's the Halloween time of year
Everyday I like being me with my friends
But on Halloween it's fun to pretend
I use my imagination and see
What do I want to be?
I'll use my imagination and see
What do I want to be?

videos.title: It's a Beautiful World | Es Un Mundo Hermoso | En Español | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
It's a Beautiful World by Jack Hartmann en Españo is the Spanish version of It's a World of Wonder.
It's a Beautiful Word by Jack Hartmann is a  science song for kids that  illustrates that the world is full of wonder.  Plants, animals and the world around us are full of wonder in this science song for children. Enjoy a World of Wonder in this life science song for kids.  The lyrics below contain the Spanish words to this song along with the English meaning of the lyrics

It's A Beautiful World Lyrics
Plantas creciendo          Plants are growing
Rios fluyendo                  Rivers are flowing
Aves   volando                Birds are flying    
Ballenas nadando         Whales are swimming

Las estreellas brillan        The stars shine bright
Es un Mundo Hermoso    It's a Beautiful World
Mira para arriba                Look to to the sky
Nubes se forman              Clouds are forming
Cae la Lluvia                       Rain is falling
Se ven los relampagos      We see the lightning
Se oyen los truenos             We hear the thunder
Es un Mundo Hermoso   It's a Beautiful World
Las estreellas brillan        The stars shine bright
Es un Mundo Hermoso    It's a Beautiful World
Mira para arriba                Look to to the sky
Gorillas caminando          Gorillas are walking

La Nieve cayendo               Snow is falling
Es un Mundo Hermoso   It's a Beautiful World
Las estreellas brillan        The stars shine bright
Es un Mundo Hermoso    It's a Beautiful World
Mira para arriba                Look to to the sky
La sciencia es asombrosa, y aprendiendo como las!  Cosas funcionan usa tus cinco sentidos!

videos.title: Nonfiction Text Features | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Nonfiction Text Features by Jack Hartmann is an informative and fun way to learn about the text features in nonfiction books. Learn the acronym TSTIGBCCMD and it will help you to remember the important nonfiction text features
T- Titles
S-Subtitles
T-Table of contents
I- Index
G- Glossary
B- Bold Print
C- Captions
C- Charts, graphs and tables
M- Maps
D- Diagrams 
Learn what each of these text features does and how it contributes to your learning and understanding of nonfiction books.


Non-Fiction Text Features Lyrics
Non-Fiction Text Features
Help you make sense of what you are reading
These features you could use         
To decide what information is important to you

Sing and memorize these letters
And they can help you remember
T-S-T-I-G B-C-C-M-D
T-S-T-I-G B-C-C-M-D
Here’s what the letters stand for and what they mean
T is for titles
Titles are short and help you figure out
In a few words it tells you what you’ll learn about
S is for subtitles
Subtitles give you more information about the title
Sometimes it’s called an alternative title
T is for table of contents
Table of contents tells you what’s in the book
And the page, chapter or section in which you should look
I is for index
Index is usually at the back of the text
It’s a list of the names and topics and what pages to check
G is for glossary
Glossary defines important words in the book
It’s like a mini dictionary, take a look
B is for bold words
Bold words stand out with thicker lines
To get your attention and highlight
C is for captions
Captions tell you more about a photo or illustration
The words help you with an explanation
C stands for charts, graphs and tables
Charts, graphs and tables are for you and me
They help make information easier to read
M is for maps
Maps show location, north, south, east or west
A place in the world, related to the text
D is for diagrams
Diagrams are drawings that show how something works
They let you see clearly all the different parts

Help you make sense of what you are reading
These features you could use         
To decide what information is important to you

These Are the Short Vowel Sounds by Jack Hartmann identifies the short vowels and their sounds.
 Learn the vowels are A E I O U. Learn the short vowel sounds for each of the vowels and an object that starts with each of the short vowels in this short vowel sound song for kids by Jack Hartmann. These are the English vowels.

videos.title: Punctuation POWER! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Punctuation Power by Jack Hartmann is about how punctuation is such a powerful part of writing and reading. Punctuation Power tells us we use a period in a statement to make a full stop for a complete thought. Punctuation Power explains that a question mark is used to get information when you are wondering about something. We use an explanation point to show strong emotion or when something is great or awesome. We use a comma to pause or separate items in a sentence.  Use the power of punctuation to make your writing powerful! 


Punctuation Power Lyrics

A period’s used to make a full stop
After a statement you put a dot

A question mark’s used to get information
When you’re wondering about something

An exclamation point is used to show strong emotion

videos.title: Springtime Dance! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Springtime Dance by Jack Hartmann celebrates spring with springtime dances  that will motivate all young children to move and dance! Springtime Dance can be used as a great brain breaks activity too. Help get lots of wiggles out and get everyone thinking about spring. Teachers and parents can use this upbeat dance song to introduce so many topics about spring (  flowers ready to bloom, grass and the leaves on trees growing again and turning green, the weather getting warmer, getting closer to the last months of school, bugs and insects, and lots more )
Springtime Dance can also highlight your spring calendar lessons and learning about the seasons and how they are a cycle and go round and round. Spring is also a time we can more of our animal friends.  Enjoy this spring brain break song as you celebrate 
Let your children dance and sing to celebrate spring with Springtime Dance!

videos.title: Grandma and Grandpa Move Along!  Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Grandma and Grandpa Move Along by Jack Hartmann shows us that people of all ages love to move and have fun.  Move along with Grandma and Grandpa as they swim in the water, do their special dances, take a walk in the park and keep moving.  Moving is important for all ages, show Grandma and Grandpa how you move too!  Moving keeps Grandma and Grandpa feeling young in this Grandma and Grandpa Move Along song.

videos.title: Fractions, Fractions! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Fractions, Fractions by Jack Hartmann shows how fractions are parts of a whole.  Words by Teka Neal, Vandenberg World Culture Academy Room 7 and Jack Hartmann.  
Learn about the numerator and denominator in this fractions song for kids.  Divide the pizza in to 2 equal parts and learn that 1/2 is 1 of 2 equal parts and that 2/2 make a whole. Divide the pizza into 3 equal parts and  learn that 1/3 is one of 3 equal parts and that 3/3 make a whole. Divide the pizza into 4 equal parts and learn that 1/4 is one of 4 equal parts and that 4/4 makes a whole.
Words by Teka Neal, Vandenberg World Culture Academy Room 7 and Jack Hartmann. Music by Jack Hartmann.  Thank you Teka for you and your students being the inspiration for Fractions, Fractions. 

Fractions, Fractions Lyrics
Fractions, Fractions what do you see?
Pieces of a whole divided evenly
The denominator is the whole
The numerator is the part
Together they help you understand, how to break things apart
The denominator is the number under the line, and tells how many parts make the whole
The numerator is the number above the line, and tells how many parts of the whole
Fractions, Fractions helps you understand the parts of a whole
Come on and slice this pizza with me
Divide the pizza in half, evenly
Now get your brain into action
Count the slices and say the fraction
1/2
2/2
2/2 equal a whole

Now get your brain into action

Now get your brain into action

4/4
4/4 equal a whole
Come on and slice this pizza with me
Divide the pizza in fifths , evenly
Now get your brain into action

videos.title: The Water Cycle | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Water Cycle by Jack Hartmann will help you learn about the water cycle and the three (3) stages of the water cycle; evaporation, condensation and precipitation. The Water Cycle is focused on the physical science topic of learning the three essential phases of the water cycle. Children sing along and can follow with movements and motions showing how the cycle goes round and round. The song includes a simple verse for each phase that describes the specific process in each phase. Your children will get all the basics about the water cycle’s three phases by listening to Jack’s song, Water Cycle.

The Water Cycle, keeps going up and down
The Water Cycle, it goes around and round

Condensation
Precipitation
Keeps going round and round

Precipitation
Keeps going round and round, and round

Evaporation happens first
The sun heats surface waters of the earth
The water’s changed to a gas right there
Gets lighter and rises into the air

Condensation is when the gas gets cooled in the upper atmosphere
Turns liquid or solid forming clouds
And, yo, it might start falling down

Precipitation is when the clouds
Get liquids or solids all around
The particles get heavy and grow
Then fall as rain, hail, sleet or snow
