videos.title: Braille Alphabetic Word Signs | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Braille Alphabet With Alphabetic Word Signs by Jack Hartmann and Jessica Hayes MS ED was developed to assist  students with visual impairments and their families learn the Braille Alphabet and their corresponding word signs. Each letter of the alphabet has a corresponding word sign. The letters of the alphabet when they are standing alone have a corresponding word sign. For example In Braille when you read the letter k, it can make the /k/ sound when part of a word. It represents the word knowledge when it is standing alone with a space on either side. In this song, we are representing the Alphabetic Braille Word Signs. Most of the letter of the alphabet have a corresponding alphabetic word sign. The letter 'a' stand for the word "a", the letter 'i" is written with a capital sign and stands for the word I and the letter "o" never stands alone. We hope you enjoy learning more about the Braille alphabet.  

The Braille Alphabet Lyrics
Let's learn the letters of the alphabet
They'll help you learn to read
You can read with your fingers very well
Start with ABC
Concentrate and do your best
Come on and sing along
Follow me, have fun and feel the beat

videos.title: The Braille Alphabet | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Braille Alphabet by Jack Hartmann is song that teaches the braille alphabet.  This song came about from a very special request from a group of visually impaired students who heard our See It, Say It, Sign It video with the ASL sign for each letter of the alphabet. They asked their teacher, Jessica Hayes to write us and ask for a braille alphabet song.  With the help of many expert's contributions, The Braille Alphabet Song was created.  Braille consists of various patterns of raised dots arranged in a braille letter, a braille number or a punctuation mark. In the Braille Alphabet consists of six dot which are numbered vertically.  This Braille Alphabet Song is used with words that are tangible examples for each letter. The words used in this video were specifically chosen for their tangible attributes to assist the child with a visual impairment. The caregiver may collect the items in advance and provide the items to the child to feel as they are learning the alphabet and their corresponding sounds.
 Thank you for being our inspiration for The Braille Alphabet Song.

videos.title: Let's Sign It | Common ASL Phrases Vol. 1 | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Let's Sign It by Jack Hartmann demonstrates how to sign common phrases and words with ASL.
Learn how to sign the following common  words and phrases with common asl signs:
Hello
How are you?
Thank you
 You're welcome
Help me
Please
I love you
Goodbye
 Sing along with Jack and learn ASL signs for the common phrases in this ASL song. All of the content in this video was overseen by Patrick “Mr. Shineyhead” Fischer, CDI (Certified Deaf Interpreter). Patrick is from several generations of fine artists and performers from Germany and has extensive experience in all things related to theatre and art. Patrick has been involved in a variety of artistic positions (artist, performer, director, producer, teacher, Director of Artistic Sign Language, and consultant) as well as participation in a variety of performances (storytelling, acting, and comedy) internationally. 
Patrick launched his business in 2005 as a way to provide services to those who want to learn more about theatre through deaf eyes. When not "working" in theatre he taught American Sign Language and deaf studies/deaf history, and currently is a certified ASLTA Master instructor.  He has taught under the Sign Language Studies Program and Sign Language Interpretation Program in Portland, Oregon.  Also, Patrick is a Deaf Language Model in Alaska. Patrick has his Graphic Design degree, and he is also an awarded professional artist and co-owner/marketing designer of the firm, Expert Business Support, Inc. Patrick now resides in Connecticut.
Our interpreter, Rachael, learned to communicate with her brother, who is deaf, through sign language and is her motivation and inspiration for this video.

videos.title: The Braille Numbers | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Braille Numbers Song by Jack Hartmann is about recognizing the numbers 1 -0 in Braille.  
 This song came about from a very special request from a group of visually impaired students. 
For the Braille Numbers In United English Braille (UEB), the first 10 letters of the alphabet make up the dots for the numbers 0-9.  A Braille reader places a special symbol, the number sign (dot 3,4,5,6) before the first 10 letters to make them turn into numbers. A number sign, dot 1, is the number one.
In this song you are introduced to the braille numbers 0-9. Number  0 is introduced last as it is the same dots as letter "j".

Braille Numbers Song Lyrics
To learn the numbers in braille, we use the first 10 letters of the alphabet
A-J
To learn the numbers in braille, we always start with the number sign
Dot 3,4,5,6
Come on and sing along
Everybody have fun
And do the Braille Number Song
Number sign dot 1 
Is number 1
Number sign dot 1,2
Is number 2
Number sign dot 1,4
Is number 3
Number sign dot 1,4,5
Is number 4
Number sign dot 1,5
Is number 5
Number sign dot 1,2,4
Is number 6
Number sign dot 1,2,4,5
Is number 7
Number sign dot 1,2,5
Is number 8
Number sign dot 2,4
Is number 9
Number sign dot 2,4,5
Is number 0
To learn the numbers in braille, we use the first 10 letters of the alphabet
A-J
To learn the numbers in braille, we always start with the number sign
Dot 3,4,5,6
Come on and sing along
Everybody have fun
And do the Braille Number Song

videos.title: The Nemeth Braille Numbers | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Nemeth Braille Numbers by Jack Hartmann demonstrate the Nemeth Braille Numbers. Braille readers have a separate Braille code to learn for Math and Science. One of those codes is the Nemeth Code. Students use symbols in the Nemeth Code to complete mathematical operations and scientific formulas. The beginning Braille reader needs to learn the Nemeth Code numbers to complete assignments in their math class. While creating the Nemeth Code numbers, the user will continue to use the number sign before the number but will not use dots 1 and 2, only the bottom four dots of the Braille Cell. The shapes of the numbers are the same, but in the lower part of the braille cell. The number 1 in Nemeth Code is number sign, dot 2. In this song you are reminded to use the number sign that was previously learned, as well as a reminder to orientate to the bottom part of the Braille Cell. 


Braille Nemeth Numbers Song
Let's Learn the Nemeth Braille Numbers 0 to 9
Use the 4 dots down and not the 2 up high
We still always use the number sign
Learn the Nemeth Braille Numbers 0 to 9
Number sign dot 2 is number 1
Number sign dot 2,3 is number 2
Number sign dot 2,5 is number 3
Number sign dot 2,5,6 is number 4
Number sign dot 2,6 is number 5
Number sign dot 2,3,5 is number 6
Number sign dot 2,3,5,6 is number 7
Number sign dot 2,3,6 is number 8
Number sign dot 3,5 is number 9
Number sign dot 3,5,6 is number 0
Let's Learn the Nemeth Braille Numbers 0 to 9
Use the 4 dots down and not the 2 up high
We still always use the number sign
Learn the Nemeth Braille Numbers 0 to 9

videos.title: Vowel Sound Hound Dogs  Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Vowel Sound Hound Dogs by Jack Hartmann teaches the short medial vowel sounds.  Learn the short vowel sounds, a, e , i , o, u with Jack and the hound dogs.  Vowel Sound Hound Dogs  is a twist on the regular vowel sound songs. In this song, children will hear and act out medial vowel sounds (the vowel sounds heard in the middle of words), which is a more complicated skill than beginning vowel sounds. Get ready to bark, howl and say your vowel sounds! Move along with the action words to build brain and body connections. Wag your tail for the short a sound. Beg for a bone for the short e sound. Dig in the dirt for the short i sound. Flop your ears for the short o sound. Give a jump for the short u sound as you build body and brain connections learning the middle vowel sounds. 


LYRICS:

Vowel Sound Hound Dogs Lyrics

A - E - I - O - U - ah ooh
A - E - I - O - U - ah ooh

They go ŏ - ŏ - ŏ flop

They go ŭ - ŭ - ŭ jump

videos.title: Dancing Star! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Dancing Star by Jack Hartmann is a movement oriented, brain breaks song. Get your students up and dancing to the fun moves as they listen carefully to follow directions. Each student can be a Dancing Star while doing a wide variety of dance and movements. 
Brain Breaks engage children  and are an important part of learning. They give students a chance to assimilate prior learning while oxygenating the brain. These classroom brain breaks enhance energy and relaxation. 
Dancing Star can be compared to the hugely popular Cha Cha Slide. Children follow directions and move together.  You can use brain breaks to start your day, anytime children need a positive physical activity, after lunch or for indoor recess on days with bad weather. 
 My brain breaks songs can be used in physical education classes too. Teachers love how the children have to stop and put their hands to their ears to listen carefully. This is a great song to teach children about following directions.
Jack Hartmann's Dancing Star is sure to become a favorite.

Dancing Star Words and Music by Jack Hartmann, copyright 2011 Jack Hartmann www.jackhartmann.com 

LYRICS:

Dancing Star
 
Watch me, watch me I can raise the roof 
Watch me, watch me I can shake it loose   
Shake it down then jump it up so far
I can shine like a dancing star 
 
Let’s get loose and warm it up 
All together, step to the front
 Jump to the back and clap 
Raise your arms up in the air 
Back and forth like you just don’t care
Right leg stomp to the left
Left leg stomp to the right 
One arm up, shake your hips 
I can disco just like this
Now stop and pose 
Be cool, slide to the right 
Be cool, slide to the left
Jump up and count 4
1,2,3,4
Robo dance, move it, lock it 
Like a robot 
You got it !
 
Watch me, watch me I can raise the roof 
Watch me, watch me I can shake it loose   
Shake it down then jump it up so far
I can shine like a dancing star 
 
Now everybody square it up 
Step to the back
 Slide to the right 
Step to the front
Slide to the left 
Now cabbage patch, arms circle around
Be cool, get down
Country dance, stomp and clap 
Now turn around
Clap like this 
Clap, clap, clap, clap, clap
Turn around again
Clap like this 
Clap, clap, clap, clap
Right leg stomp to the left
Left leg stomp to the right 
Now jump up, crisscross, crisscross 
Shake your shoulders, shake your hips 
Shake it like a salt shaker, like this
Now turn around
Clap like this 
Clap, clap, clap, clap, clap
Turn around again
Clap like this
Clap, clap, clap, clap, clap, clap
Do your own dance
Dance free
Now freeze
Let’s cool it down, do the sprinkler 
Take it down
That was fun
We’re done

videos.title: Dinosaur STOMP! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Dinosaur Stomp by Jack Hartmann will have you stomping and dancing with Jack and some adorable dinosaurs.  This fun dinosaur dance song will have you stomping with a T-Rex, swaying with a Brontosaurus and swinging your dinosaur tail to the left and right with a Triceratops and Brontosaurus in this dinosaur song for kids. 

The Dinosaur Stomp Lyrics:

Hey, Brontosaurus, Triceratops, hey T-Rex
Everyone let's dance
Come on everybody do a dance with me
It started long ago when dinosaurs roamed free
When they wanted to party, play and romp
They'd do a little thing called the Dinosaur Stomp
A big T-Rex showed me how to do it, follow me

Lift your right leg up and take some giant steps
Lift your left leg high and do the same again
Walk like a big Brontosaurus swaying back and forth
Turn around and round and give a mighty roar
Now swing your tail to the right and to the left and jump!
Now you're doin' the Dinosaur Stomp
Man, this was bigger than the Jurassic Jump

Now hop to the right, stomp, stomp
Then hop to the left, stomp, stomp
Shake, shake way down low, stomp, stomp
Shake, shake way up high, stomp, stomp
Now swing your tail to the right, and to the left and jump
Now you're doing the Dinosaur Stomp
It was a dance hit for over two million years

All of the dinosaurs, everyone
We're movin' and groovin' having dinosaur fun!
Then the T-Rex said "Let the music stop"
But, they all kept doin' the Dinosaur Stomp
Oh, they wouldn't stop, they just loved it, lets do it again.

Lift your right leg up and take some giant steps
Lift your left leg high and do the same again
Walk like a big Brontosaurus swaying back and forth
Turn around and round and make a mighty roar
Now swing your tail to the right and to the left and jump!
Now you're doin' the Dinosaur Stomp
Man, it's the coolest

Then the T-Rex said "Let the music stop"
But, they all kept doin' the Dinosaur Stomp
Oh, they wouldn't stop, they just loved it, lets do it again.

Lift your right leg up and take some giant steps
Lift your left leg high and do the same again
Walk like a big Brontosaurus swaying back and forth
Turn around and round and make a mighty roar
Now swing your tail to the right and to the left and jump!
Now you're doin' the Dinosaur Stomp
Man, it's the coolest

videos.title: Happy Father's Day! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Happy Father's Day by Jack Hartmann celebrates Fathers on their special day and everyday.
Wish your dad a Happy Father's Day as you clap your hands, shake your hips, do a dance and raise the roof to show all the Fathers how very special they are on Father's Day and everyday. This song is sure to make your daddy feel very special and loved this Father's Day and everyday.

videos.title: DADDY | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
DADDY by Jack Hartmann celebrates Dads on Father's Day and everyday. Spell out the word 
D-A-D-D-Y and sing about all the special things Dads do in this Father's Day song for kids.  After each verse there is a letter deletion for the word D-A- D- D-Y.  Clap in place of each missing letter as you spell the word DADDY.  Happy Father's Day to all the terrific dads!

videos.title: These Are the Teen Numbers! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
These Are the Teen Numbers by Jack Hartmann shows the different ways teen numbers 11-19 can be represented. Learn that teen numbers can be shown as number words, on a number line, with fingers, as pictures, with tally marks ,on dice, as numerals, on dominoes and on ten frames in this video on teen numbers. Each of these ways to show teen numbers are demonstrated in These are the Teen Numbers. Learn that teen numbers are the numbers 11 -19. Jack Hartmann teen numbers song.


These Are the Teen Numbers Lyrics
These Are the Teen Numbers
I can show them in many ways
These Are the Teen Numbers
Look and listen and learn today
Let's go from 11 to 19
I can show 11 as a numeral, like this
I can show 12 as a word, like this
I can show 13 on a number line like this
I can show 14 with dice, like this
I can show 15 with fingers, like this
I can show 16 with pictures, like this
I can show 17 with tallies, like this
I can show 18 with dominoes, like this
I can show 19 on ten frames, like this
These Are the Teen Numbers
I can show them in many ways
These Are the Teen Numbers
Look and listen and learn today
I can show 11 with pictures, like this
I can show 12 with dominoes, like this
I can show 13 on ten frames, like this
I can show 14 as a word, like this
I can show 15 with tallies, like this
I can show 16 as a numeral, like this
I can show 17 with fingers, like this
I can show 18 on a number line, like this
I can show 19 on dice, like this
These Are the Teen Numbers
I can show them in many ways
These Are the Teen Numbers
Look and listen and learn today

videos.description:
All Around the World by Jack Hartmann is a stretching to the beat video. Count it out and stretch to the front, side, back and side to the count in a circular motion. This is a terrific classroom brain breaks for kids song and stretching song for kids. All Around the World can be used as an exercise movement song or a quick way to make brain and body connections with the spatial  movement directions,

videos.title: Division Tables 1 | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Learn the division facts for dividing by 1 with Division Tables 1 by Jack Hartmann.  Learn that any number divided by 1 equals the same number.  In this Division Tables 1 the problems are presented in order 1 through 10. The first time through say the division facts by 1 at the same time Jack gives the answer. The second time through the 1 division tables Jack gives time for you to answer first, which reinforces the correct answer and the third time through Jack leaves the answer blank for you to answer on your own. 

Division Tables 1 Lyrics
Division is breaking a number up into an equal number of parts
Let's learn the division tables now
Get ready, get set, let's start
Divided by 1
1 ÷ 1 = 1 
2 ÷ 1 = 2
3 ÷ 1 = 3
4 ÷ 1 = 4
5 ÷ 1 = 5
6 ÷ 1 = 6
7 ÷ 1 = 7
8 ÷ 1 = 8
9 ÷ 1 = 9
10÷ 1 = 10
Now you answer before me
1 ÷ 1 = 1 
2 ÷ 1 = 2
3 ÷ 1 = 3
4 ÷ 1 = 4
5 ÷ 1 = 5
6 ÷ 1 = 6
7 ÷ 1 = 7
8 ÷ 1 = 8
9 ÷ 1 = 9
10÷ 1 = 10
Now you answer all on your own
1 ÷ 1 = 1 
2 ÷ 1 = 2
3 ÷ 1 = 3
4 ÷ 1 = 4
5 ÷ 1 = 5
6 ÷ 1 = 6
7 ÷ 1 = 7
8 ÷ 1 = 8
9 ÷ 1 = 9
10÷ 1 = 10

videos.title: Move It Your Way! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Move It Your Way by Jack Hartmann is a creative movement song. Move along in your own special way to the suggested animals.  This song concept was suggested to us by our wonderful veteran kindergarten teacher friend, Laura Lopez. This video is meant to inspire individual self expression so Move It Your Way and have fun in this Jack Hartmann video. This animal version of Move It Your Way will be the first in a series of creative movement videos. Look for others in the series of Move It Your Way videos that will include machines and other things that move.

videos.description:
My Dog and Me by Jack Hartmann was written in memory of our Ellie Belle. This video was made possible from all the wonderful and touching submissions from all our friends with their fur babies.  We hope you love this song as much as we do. 


My Dog and Me
She was born in the country, in a town nobody knows
She had the sweetest brown eyes
and the softest golden coat
I knew she'd been hurt, she was scared
So I rescued her that day
She needed me to give her a happy home
I needed her so I could love her so
My dog and me
we were meant to be together
Right there for each other
through he good times and the bad
My dog and me
will be friends forever
And I'll always remember 
all the ways she made me smile
I named her Ellie Belle
'cause she was a country girl
I'd throw and catch the frisbee 
She was the best in all the world
And though she always stayed a little shy and afraid
She'd swim in the roughest water
Like the bravest dog God ever made

and I gave her  happy home

we were meant to be together

we'll be friends forever

videos.title: Let's Make This a Great School Year | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Let's Make This a Great School Year by Jack Hartmann welcomes teachers and student alike back to school and sends a positive message that together everyone can make it a great school year.
Learn a lot, give it all you've got, be kind to everybody, practice reading and writing, be polite, learn about math and science while you build your brain and body and it is sure to be a great school year. Welcome back!

videos.title: Ollie the Otter | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Ollie Otter by Jack Hartmann introduces Jack's friend Ollie the Otter.
Ollie the Otter was inspired by the otter that lives in the lake by Jack's house in Florida.
Jack loves to spend his mornings watching Ollie by his lake.  The neighborhood
children love to come and say hello to Ollie, and watch him from Jack's dock on the lake.
There's so much to learn about our animal friends and we hope Ollie captures
your heart just like he has captured ours. Swim Ollie, swim. We love to watch your
adventures. Dive Ollie, dive, we love to watch you play.

Ollie the Otter

videos.title: Today is Sunday! | Open Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Today is Sunday Open version by Jack Hartmann is a calendar song for the day of Sunday.  Today is Sunday will spell out the letters in Sunday, teach about the day before and the day after Sunday and show the ASL sign for Sunday in a simple easy and repetitive way that is easy for children to repeat. Our consultant for the sign language is  Patrick "Mr. Shineyhead" Fischer, CDI (Certified Deaf Interpreter) and ASLTA Master instructor. He has taught under the Sign Language Interpretation Program and has instructed under the Sign Language Studies Program for over 30 years.
These days of the weeks songs were inspired by a kindergarten teacher who requested I write a special song for each day of the week. 
In this open version of Today is Sunday I allow for students to fill in the information for the day, the day before and after Sunday,  Look for our  short version of this song or our full version to meet your classroom needs accordingly.

Today is Sunday Lyrics
Good morning, good day
Today's name is Sunday
Today's name is Sunday
Yesterday was Saturday
Tomorrow will be Monday
Today's name is Sunday
Sunday, Sunday
Let's make this a really good day

Here Come the Sounds Zed Version by Jack Hartmann is an alphabet recognition and letter sounds song. The Science of Reading Philosophy emphasizes  introducing letter sounds first and then identifying the letter/ sound association.

Let's learn the sounds and see the pictures
Have lots of fun and sing with me
/A/ /a/ apple
/A/ is the sound of the letter A a

/B / is the sound of the letter B b
/C  / / c /  cat
/C / is the sound of the letter C c
/D  / / d / dog
/D / is the sound of the letter D d
/ E / /e  /  egg
/E / is the sound of the letter E e
/ F / /f /  fish
/F / is the sound of the letter F f

/ G/ is the sound of the letter G g
/ H / / h /  horse
/H / is the sound of the letter H h
/ I / /i  /  igloo
/I / is the sound of the letter I i

/J / is the sound of the letter J j

videos.title: The RIGHT or WRONG Halloween Song | Halloween Trivia and Safety for Kids | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Right or Wrong Halloween Song by Jack Hartmann is a fun way to engage students in auditory discrimination between the right or wrong Halloween statement. Jack will test students' calendar skills, safety skills, and Halloween awareness skills. Sing along and have fun in this lighthearted learning song about Halloween. 

The Right or Wrong Halloween Song Lyrics Copyright 2022 
C’mon listen with your ears
Think with your brain
Have fun and sing along
Say treat if I’m right, trick if I’m wrong
It’s the Right or Wrong Halloween Song
It’s Halloween!

Listen, Halloween happens in the month of June
Trick or treat
Trick!  Halloween is always in the month of October
It’s Halloween!

Listen, on Halloween we trick or treat for broccoli
Trick or treat 
Trick!  Not broccoli, we trick or treat for candy
It’s Halloween!

Listen, have grownups check your candy before you eat it
Trick or treat 
Treat!  Yes, always have grownups check your candy first
It’s Halloween!


C’mon listen with your ears
Think with your brain
Have fun and sing along
Say treat if I’m right, trick if I’m wrong
It’s the Right or Wrong Halloween Song
It’s Halloween!

Listen, when we trick or treat, we should go alone
Trick or treat 
Trick!  Never go alone, trick or treat with family or friends
It’s Halloween!

Listen – Halloween is in the season of fall
Trick or treat 
Treat! Right, Halloween is in October in the fall
It’s Halloween

Listen – on Halloween we give each other valentines
Trick or treat 
No, we don’t give each other valentine’s
We dress up and have fun!

It’s Halloween!

videos.title: How Many Coins Make a Dollar? | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
How Many Coins Make Make a Dollar? by Jack Hartmann will help you discover how much a dollar is worth and how many of each coins equals one dollar. Learn that it takes 100 pennies to make a dollar and see what one hundred pennies look like. Learn that 20 nickels make a dollar and see what 20 nickels looks like in comparison. Learn that 10 dimes make a dollar and see what 10 dimes look like.  Learn that 4 quarters make a dollar and see what 4 quarters look like in this money song for kids. How Many Coins Make a Dollar is an interactive video that will have A singing along as they learn about the value of a dollar and how many of each American coins is equivalent to a dollar.

videos.title: Bossy R! | ER, IR and UR Words | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Bossy R, ER, IR and UR Words by Jack Hartmann teaches that r is so bossy it controls the vowels and bosses them around to the point that they sound different than the vowels usually sound. When r is in front of the vowels e, i, and u, the r bosses them to say the same /er/ sound.  Sing along with Jack and build your brain and body as you learn about r controlled vowels and their sounds. Learn what r controlled vowels sound like as you learn and see examples of er, ir, and ur words.

videos.description:
Sing the Phonics Song by Jack Hartmann Zed version is a letter sound/alphabet recognition song for our international friends. 
Sing along with Jack and Rachael as they sing the sounds and give examples of words with the same beginning sounds in Sing the Phonics Song Zed Version.
In this video, our very own Jack Hartmann teaches you how to sing the Phonics Song in Zed Version! This fun, catchy song is the perfect way to teach your kids the Science of Reading!

Singing the Phonics Song is a great way to teach your kids the basics of reading. This fun, catchy song is easy to learn and sung in simple, phonetic letters. If you're looking for a fun way to introduce phonics to your kids, then check out this Zed Version of the Phonics Song!

videos.title: Tall, Small, and Fall! | Zed Version | Move to the Alphabet | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Tall, Small and Fall  Zed version by Jack Hartmann is an alphabet song that has you move to the configurations of each letter.  If the letter is tall, reach up to the sky. If the letter is small put your hands on your waist. If the letter falls place your hands on your knees.  Learn that the lowercase letters of the alphabet can be Tall, Small or Fall.  
If you're having trouble learning the ABCs, it might be time to move to the alphabet! In this video, Jack Hartmann teaches you how to move like all the letters using tall, small and fall. This move to the alphabet will help you learn the ABCs faster and easier!

Don't wait any longer - try out this fun and unique way to learn the ABCs! With this method, you'll learn the letters faster and have more fun doing it! Plus, it's a great way to get your child motivated to learn the alphabet while building your brain and body!

I Can Count to 100 Version 2 by Jack Hartmann will help you build your brain and body as you exercise and count to 100 by 1's.  Jack will lead you in a different exercise for each group of 10 numbers in this counting to 100 song for kids. 
In this video, Jack Hartmann teaches you how to move and count to 100! He uses fun, animated drawings to help you learn how to count and move efficiently.

This is a fun and helpful video for kids and adults alike! By the end, you'll be able to move and count to 100 like a pro! This video is perfect for anyone who wants to improve their physical fitness or learn a new skill fast.

Squirrel Dance and Freeze by Jack Hartmann will have you moving and grooving with your favorite fun squirrel. Have fun and move along with the fun squirrel dances but listen carefully to when the squirrel says to freeze in Squirrel Dance and Freeze. Squirrel Dance and Freeze features Jack's dog, Cali. Cali really likes squirrels and helped inspire Jack to write Squirrel Dance and Freeze. Cali likes to freeze too whenever she sees a squirrel.

videos.title: A Chance to Be Children | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
A Chance to Be Children by Jack Hartmann is a child advocacy song for children. Jack wrote this song to celebrate childhood and all the discoveries and joys of being a child. We must give them 
A Chance to be Children. Celebrate their discoveries and let children learn as they play and grow with developmentally appropriate practices. This song is for both parents and teachers to see the joy in play and learning.
Give them memories to last all their lives. 
A special thank you for sending us the beautiful pictures depicting our song. 
Special recognition for the beautiful voice of Rachael Smith and her vocal students!

A Chance to Be Children

What gifts must we give to our children
What gifts must we give them for life
Give them hope, give them strength
Give them love, give them faith
Give them memories to last all their lives

And let us
Give them a chance to be children
Give them a chance to be children for a while
Then they’ll grow up someday
 And remember today           
All the love and the hope of a child
All the love and the hope of a child

Will you stand up and reach out to the children
Will you stand up and reach out with your heart
Give them laughter, give them care
Give them moments to share
Give them memories to last all their life
And always

Let them play – 
and they will have a happy heart
Let them dream 
and all the world will share a part
Let them sing – 
and they’ll sing out their own song
Hear them sing, hear them sing….


Give us a chance to be children
Give us a chance to be children for a while
Then we’ll grow up someday
And remember today
All the love and the hope of a child
All the love and the hope of a child
Give us a chance to be children
Give us a chance to be children for a while
Then we’ll grow up someday
And remember today
All the love and the hope of a child

videos.title: Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse by Jack Hartmann is a huge hit with kids. Dance around the Christmas Tree with your favorite Christmas mouse, Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse in our fun, holiday song.

Milton shares how excited he is for Christmas to come as he dances around the Christmas tree.  Milton chicken dances, twists and does the chugga, chugga like a choo-choo around the Christmas tree. 

This kid’s Christmas song is sure to make Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse your favorite mouse as he sings in his cute mouse voice “I’m Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse”.

Take time to smell the Christmas tree and take a brain break to celebrate and sing with Jack Hartmann’s, "Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse”.



It was the night before Christmas
and all through the house
There was one creature stirring, it was Milton the Mouse
He was swinging his tail under the Christmas tree
Then he said, “I love to dance, will you dance with me”
He started shaking, just like this, 
Twisting with his arms and hips
Hopping the Reindeer Hop
 Rocking–he wouldn’t stop
Then I said, “Hey, little mouse what is this all about?"
“I’m Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse”
He loves to dance all around the house
“I’m Milton the Dancing Christmas Mouse"
 "I like to move”
Then Milton started moving like a choo-choo train
He went chugga, chugga, chugga like a choo choo train
Choo, choo follow me
Let’s do the Chicken Dance around the Christmas tree

He started shaking, just like this,

He loves to dance all around the house

videos.description:
Good Choices by Jack Hartmann is a video about making good choices in home, school and play.
Working problems out and helping someone smile each day are examples of Good Choices in this positive action song.
In this video, Jack Hartmann discusses the importance of making good choices for kids. He shares important facts about making good choices, and offers helpful tips on how to raise kids who make good choices.
If you want to raise kids who make good choices, then you need to watch this video! Jack Hartmann provides informative and entertaining information on making good choices, and provides helpful tips on how to raise kids who make good choices. If you're looking for resources on raising good kids, then you need to watch this video!

Every day we get to make choices

videos.title: It's a Cylinder! | 3D Shapes Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
It's a Cylinder Lyrics by Jack Hartmann is about the 3D shape of a cylinder. Learn that a cylinder has 1 curved surface that goes all the way around. A cylinder has 2 curved edges. A cylinder has 2 flat surfaces. A cylinder has 2 circular bases that are the same. A cylinder has 0 vertices.  
Learn about cylinders in our environment.  As an extension activity have students look for the cylinders named in the song or look for other cylinders around them.
In this song for kids, we learn about the great cylinder shape. Cylinders are important in many different contexts, from cars to stadiums to homes!

This song is perfect for kids who are learning about 3D shapes. We learn about the cylinder shape, its properties and its uses. If you're looking for a fun song to learn about cylinders, this is the perfect choice!
Shapes are one of the most important concepts for kids to learn, and this song is a great way to teach them about cylinders, one of the most common 3D shapes. With catchy lyrics and a catchy tune, this song is perfect for kids of all ages!

Jack gives real-life examples of cones in our environment. Jack shows examples and non-examples of cones and students are asked to answer yes if it has the characteristics of a cone.  If the object Jack shows is not a cone,  answer no, in this interactive video about cones. 
In this fun and interactive song, Jack Hartmann teaches kids the simple but powerful concept of cones. By the end of the song, kids will be able to identify the 3D shape, cone.

videos.title: The Itsy Bitsy Spider! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Itsy Bitsy Spider by Jack Hartmann is a new video of an old favorite nursery rhyme, Itsy Bitsy Spider.  
Nursery rhymes help children develop vocabulary, which helps them learn to read! The bouncy rhythm catches the child's attention. Repetition and familiarity help the child to remember and supports language development, whilst engaging a child fosters social development.
Nursery rhymes provide learning opportunities for young children to develop key developmental skills. Nursery rhymes can often facilitate hours of creative and open-ended play. Nursery rhymes are a powerful learning source in early literacy and enable children to become interested in the rhythm and patterns of language.
Children will be inspired to never give up and reach their goals no matter what challenges they may face and have to overcome in Jack Hartmann's original verse he added to the old favorite, classic nursery rhyme.
The song is on my album, Rhymin' to the Beat Vol. 1
 http://www.jackhartmann.com/rhymin-to-the-beat-vol-1-cd/

videos.title: Homophones! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Homophones by Jack Hartmann teaches us that homophones are two or more words having the same pronunciation but different meanings. Homophones sound the same but they have different spellings and meanings.  
What Are Homophones will give examples of common homophones and will give examples of each homophone in a sentence.  Stay tuned for What Are Homophones Part 2 to master another set of homophones with Jack Hartmann.  
Homophones can be tricky words to use correctly in grammar. What Are Homophones is an engaging and active learning process to help you with these tricky words in this homophones song for kids.

videos.title: Real Heroes  Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Real Heroes by Jack Hartmann celebrates the real-life heroes around us each day. This song illustrates that superheroes are not real but in our imagination. Real-life heroes are helpers in our real world. This song gives illustrations of the real heroes and includes; firefighters, nurses, police officers, teachers, soldiers, social workers, doctors, and parents. This song illustrates the characteristics of real heroes.
Discover what it takes to be a real hero in this powerful video. 
In this video, you'll learn about the real heroes who have made a difference in the world. You'll find out what it takes to be a real hero. Watch this video to learn what it really means to be a real hero!

videos.title: How Do Animals Move? | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
How Do Animals Move? by Jack Hartmann is an interactive guessing game about how animals move. 
Move along with your favorite animals, but listen carefully when Jack asks if an animal moves a certain way. This is your chance to answer yes or no.   When you find the right movement for each animal, move along with the animal's movement. This is a great addition to a Life Science unit on animals.

videos.title: Can You Do the Secret Stories® Letter Run Challenge? | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Can You Do the Secret Stories® Letter Run Challenge? by Jack Hartmann.  This video challenges you to name the letter sounds in isolation. Jack says the letter sounds for each letter of the alphabet, the first time he sings it at a moderate pace. The second time through pick up the pace of the letter sounds for even more of a letter run challenge.  

Join Jack as he sings Katie Garner’s Secret Stories® Letter Run Challenge! Jack says the letter sounds for each letter of the alphabet, the first time he sings it at a moderate pace. The second time through pick up the pace of the letter sounds for even more of a letter run challenge.  

Shout out to Katie Garner, author of Secret Stories® Cracking the Reading Code with the Brain in Mind and the Letter Runs!

videos.title: Humpty Dumpty | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Humpty Dumpty by Jack Hartmann is an interactive version of an old favorite nursery rhyme.
Humpty Dumpty nursery rhyme, finger play has been one of our most popular nursery rhymes for young children all over the world. Now, here is the song and a video so your children can follow Jack's movements and sing along.

This cool pop music version of Humpty Dumpty engages children with a great beat that will make them want to move their bodies and sing along. Your children will be actively engaged and develop those important brain and body connections so important for their healthy development. Jack's movements are simple and easy to follow for all children. They will hear and sing along with all the rhyming, which is so important for their language development. 

Literacy studies have shown that children who are exposed to lots of rhyming activities are more likely to become better readers. So, lots of rhyming books and songs are wonderful for developing a good ear for language and awareness of words that rhyme.

Teachers and parents can use this nursery rhyme as part of a nursery rhyme unit, a rhyming awareness and language development program, or even as a fun nursery rhyme brain break.

Humpty Dumpty had a great fall

videos.title: Mr. Alligator  Chomps | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Mr. Alligator Chomps by Jack Hartmann is a fun way to chomp your favorite patterns. Listen to how Mr. Alligator chomps, and then chomp the same pattern right back.  Patterning is a very important math skill.  Patterns follow a predictable rule and that rule allows us to predict what will come next. Mathematicians say that mathematics is the study of patterns and structure in numbers, and patterns and structure in geometry.

videos.title: Letters p and q | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Letter p & q by Jack Hartmann will help students differentiate between the letter p and letter q in a fun and practical way. Learn the way each letter faces by using your fists as a powerful visual aid. 

Letters p and q Lyrics
p   q 
Reading and writing letter p and letter q
It can be confusing if you don't know what to do
So here's a little trick you can use every day
To remember p goes this way 
And q goes the other way
Put your hands in a fist
With your thumbs out
Turn your hands so, your thumbs are pointing down
Lift your hands right in front of your eyes
The p shape is your left hand
The q shape is your right
p    q
Reading and writing letter p and letter q
It can be confusing if you don't know what to do
So here's a little trick you can use every day
To remember p goes this way and q goes the other way
Put your hands in a fist
With your thumbs out
Turn your hands so, your thumbs are pointing down
Lift your hands right front of your eyes
The p shape is your left hand
The q shape is your right
Here's a lowercase p 
Look and see
Write a lowercase p in the air with me
Start in the middle
Straight down past the floor 
Back near the middle
Circle round no more
Start in the middle
Straight down past the floor 
Back near the middle
Circle round no more
Here's a lowercase q
Look and see
Write a lowercase q in the air with me
Start a little below the middle
Circle round
A little straight up
Down past the floor, curve out
Start a little below the middle
Circle round
A little straight up
Down past the floor, curve out
Reading and writing letter p and letter q
It can be confusing if you don't know what to do
So here's a little trick you can use every day
To remember p goes this way 
And q goes the other way

videos.title: Old MacDonald LIVE! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Old MacDonald Live by Jack Hartmann is a live, interactive version of Old MacDonald. Sing along with Jack and listen carefully when he asks for the animal sound of each animal.  Sing along with Jack and have fun with the animals on Old MacDonald's Farm with your best animal sounds.


Old MacDonald Live Lyrics
Hi everybody 
I'm here on Old MacDonald's Farm
And I'm ready to sing one of his favorite songs
Can you sing it with me?
Old MacDonald Had a Farm 
I've got my guitar
Let's sing together
Old McDonald Had a Farm
Ee- i -e i- o
And on that farm he had a cow
Ee- i -ee -i- o
What does the cow say?
You know
Moo
With a moo, moo here, and a moo, moo there
Here a moo, there a moo, everywhere a moo, moo
Old McDonald Had a Farm
Ee- i- ee- i- o

Old McDonald Had a Farm
Ee- i- ee- i- o
And on that farm he had a pig
Ee- i- ee- i -o
What does the pig say?
You know, you got it
Oink, oink
With an oink, oink here, and an oink, oink there
Here an oink, there an oink, everywhere an oink, oink

Old McDonald Had a Farm, ee i ee i oh
And on that farm he had some sheep
Ee- i -ee- i- o
What do the sheep say?
You know
Baaa
With a baa, baa, here and a baa, baa, there
Here a baa, there a baa, everywhere a baa, baa
With a baa, baa here, and a baa, baa there
Here a baa, there a baa, everywhere a baa, baa

Old McDonald Had a Farm 
Ee- i -ee- i- o
And on that farm, he had a horse
Ee- i- ee- i -oh
What does the horse say?
Oh, I know you've got it
Neigh
With a neigh, neigh here, and a neigh, neigh there
Here a neigh, there a neigh, everywhere a neigh, neigh
Old McDonald Had a Farm
Ee- i -ee- i- o
Ee- i -ee- i- o
One more
Ee- i -ee- i-
Big ending
O
Old MacDonald Had a Farm
That was fun
You did great!

videos.title: Get the WIGGLES Out Vol. 2! | 30 Minutes of FUN Jack Hartmann Songs! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Get the Wiggles Out Volume 2 by Jack Hartmann is 30 minutes of fun brain-break songs.  Brain breaks promote stress and anxiety relief by using short periods of movement to allow students to refocus. Research shows that taking purposeful breaks can refresh your brain and body and increases energy, productivity, and ability to focus. 
Get the Wiggles Out 2 includes the following favorite songs to get the wiggles out:

Get Up to Get Down
I Can Move My Body Like Anything 2
Let's Move
Move It to the Sounds 2
Move It and Freeze
Chicken Count
Tooty Ta
Music Makes Me Move
Born to Move
Right Here

videos.title: My Dog RAGS! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
My Dog Rags by Jack Hartmann is an old favorite movement song about a cute dog named, Rags.  Join Jack Hartmann and his cute puppy Rags in this wonderful early literacy song which includes fun alliteration and rhyming words.  Follow the movements and sing along with Jack and Rags.

I got a dog and his name is Rags
He eats so much that his tummy sags
His ears flip flop and his tail wig wags

He goes flip flop, wig wag, zig zag
He goes flip flop, wig wag, zig zag
I love Rags and he loves me
My dog Rags he loves to play
He rolls around in the mud all day
I call him, he doesn't obey
He always runs the other way
He goes flip flop, wig wag zig zag
He goes flip flop, wig wag zig zag
He goes flip flop, wig wag zig zag
I love Rags and he loves me

videos.title: Have FUN This SUMMER 2023! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Have Fun This Summer 2023, is full of summertime fun for kids.  Sing and follow the fun movements to this summertime celebration. Celebrate all the fun summertime activities that make summertime fun so exciting. The simple joys of swimming, playing in the park, throwing a ball, swinging on a swing, riding a roller coaster, flying on a plane, and making new friends are all part of this summertime celebration song.

videos.title: The Moon | Nighttime Song For Kids | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Moon by Jack Hartmann is a fantasy song about a child's fantasy of what it could be like on the moon. This song was inspired by my nephew who was fascinated by the moon as a child. The word moon was one of his first words. May the moon continue to shine its light on you.

The Moon Lyrics

So far, far away, up in the sky
A beautiful ball shines on me
If I had my wish and were up on the moon
I wonder, what wonders what I’d see

Would what I see, what would I do
And what would I feel inside
Oh, if I could just be up there on The Moon
So bright and so high in the sky
Oh I’d look all around, the castles and clouds
And marshmallow hills by the sea
Where the man in the moon
Would be singing a tune
And smiling a smile just for me
That’s what I’d see if it happened to me
That’s what I’d see on The Moon

The Moon, the Moon, shining for all to see     
The Moon, The Moon, shining its light on me

After a while, I thought I would try
Search through the mountains and caves
Where the moon dust would fly
And clouds would drift by
And bright-colored dragons and little kids playing
And so I stayed there until I would dare
To reach for a star in the sky
And when I jumped off the ground
I suddenly found, there on the moon you really can fly
That’s what I’d do if it all would be true
That’s what I’d do on The Moon

The Moon, the Moon, shining for all to see     
The Moon, The Moon, shining its light on me

Just as the night was starting to fall
I thought about how happy I am
To run and to play, so far, far away
So far, far away from my home
I remember the smiles, of Mother and Dad
Of Grandma and Grandpa, too
And I really could see, where I wanted to be
 I really could see how much they loved me
That’s what I’d feel if it all could be real
That’s what I’d feel on The Moon

The Moon, the Moon, shining for all to see

videos.description:
Body Alphabet Zed version by Jack Hartmann will build your brain and body connections as you form each letter of the alphabet with your body.  This video uses all the modalities to teach the letters of the alphabet. Auditory, visual, and kinesthetic learners will actively engage in learning the alphabet as Jack, Miss Rachel, and Miss Lisa show learners how to form each letter of the alphabet with their whole body. This alphabet recognition song can also be used to spell out words such as names or sight words using the whole body for each letter or having a group of learners spelling out words.

videos.description:
Brain Break Time by Jack Hartmann emphasizes the importance of taking brain breaks throughout the day of learning. Brain breaks allow your brain time to assimilate information and valuable learning. Brain breaks promote oxygenating your body and brain so you can refresh and get back to learning.

videos.title: Good GRAMMAR Rocks! | 30 Minutes of FUN Grammar Skills Songs!  | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Good Grammar Rocks by Jack Hartmann is a collection of our favorite grammar songs.
Learn about Punctuation Power, adjectives, parts of a sentence, contractions, prepositions, nouns, action verbs, parts of speech, vivid verbs, capitalization, capital letters, and nouns. This playlist includes the following videos:

videos.title: The Three Billy Goats Gruff! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Three Billy Goats Gruff by Jack Hartmann is a new take on an old favorite nursery rhyme. In this Three Billy Goats Gruff, the goats and the Troll learn to live together in harmony and help each other find food. This is a new story of co-operation and working together. 

Billy Goats Gruff Lyrics

Once upon a time, there were three Billy goats
Living in a valley so low
There was no grass to eat, no flowers or trees
So they said, hey, we’ve got to go
To find a meadow, to get some food
They were so hungry, but they were cool
Walking all together went the three billy goats
Bop, bop, boppin’ up the hill 
They were swinging their tails, right up the trail 
Then they stopped, and said, we’ve got to chill   
There was a bridge, over a river 
Under the bridge, there lived a Troll that made them shiver
So the first and smallest billy goat went over the bridge
He went trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap
 What?
Trip-trap  
He went trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap,
What? 
Trip-trap
And the troll said:
Who’s that trip – trappin’ over the bridge 
I’m gonna gobble you up 
No, you don’t want me, I’m small as can be 
I’m the first Billy Goat Gruff
Wait for my brother, he’s like no other 
He’s bigger and better than me 
Alright then, I’ll wait for your brother
That sounds pretty sweet 
So the second and bigger billy goat went over the bridge
He went trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap
 What?
Trip-trap  
He went trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap,
What? 
Trip-trap
Who’s that trip – trapping over the bridge
I’m gonna gobble you up
No, you don’t want me I’m small as can be 
I’m the second Billy Goat Gruff 
Wait for my brother, he’s like no other 
He’s bigger and better than me 
Alright then I’ll wait for your brother
That sounds pretty sweet 
So the third and biggest billy goat went over the bridge
He went trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap
 What?
Trip-trap  
He went trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap,
What? 
Trip-trap
Who’s that trip – trappin’ over the bridge,
I’m gonna gobble you up
No, you don’t want me I’m tough as can be 
I’m the biggest Billy Goat Gruff 
I’m really strong, with big horns 
But hey, we don’t have to fight 
I’ll help you, you help me, let’s live together in harmony
And they shook hands and gave two thumbs up 
And that’s the story of the Billy Goats Gruff 
And they all kept going
 Trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap
 What?
Trip-trap  
He went trip-trap, trip-trap, trip-trap,
What? 
Trip-trap

videos.title: Tricky Sticky Words | Said | Words Kids Need to Know By Heart  Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Tricky Sticky Words by Jack Hartmann focuses on those words that are tricky to spell. The sight word said is featured in this Tricky, Sticky Words video.  Learn about the word said.  These are challenging words for kids to read, write, and spell because they don't follow phonics rules, that's why they're tricky. They're sticky because they need to stick in your head.

Tricky Sticky Words Lyrics
Let’s learn a Tricky, Sticky Word, come on everyone
A Tricky Sticky Word, let’s have fun
We’ll count the sounds, spell it out        
And learn the tricky part
And then you’ll know the tricky sticky word by heart

They’re tricky, so practice them again and again
They’re sticky because they need to stick in your head

Let’s learn about the Tricky Sticky word “said”
Like in a sentence 
“My teacher said I’m a good helper.”
Let’s sound out the word “said”, and listen carefully to how many sounds you hear
Put up one finger for each sound
/s/ /ai/ /d/
Now let's spell the word, said
Some of the sounds you probably know 
From learning your letter sounds

The first sound /s/ is spelled with what letter? 
 s - good
The last sound /d/ is spelled with what letter? 
 d - good
The middle sound is the tricky part
 In the word said, /e/ is spelled with the  letters ai
That's the part you have to learn by heart 

The tricky, sticky part, you need to know by heart
In the word said, ai says /e/ said, said
Now let’s practice and spell the word said
S-a-i-d – said, 
S-a-i-d – said 
You’ve got it.  
They’re tricky, so practice them again and again
They’re sticky because they need to stick in your head
Let’s learn a Tricky, Sticky Word, c’mon everyone
A Tricky Sticky Word, let’s have fun
We’ll count the sounds, spell it out        
And learn the tricky part
And then you’ll know the tricky word by heart

videos.description:
Let's Have Fall Fun by Jack Hartmann highlights the many fun things about fall. Rake the leaves with Jack as you find out that the leaves turn colors and fall off the trees. Learn that Halloween and Thanksgiving are in the season of fall.  Learn that days get shorter and nights get longer in this Fall Fun song.

videos.title: Five Little Fish  Fun Finger Counting Song for Kids! Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Five Little Fish by Jack Hartmann is a count to five finger play and counting song.
 Follow the movements and pretend your five fingers are 5 Little Fish in this counting and finger play song. One by one add a fish finger – wiggle, swim, splish and splash them to the beat as you add each fish and count to five.  Wave goodbye at the end of the song and let your five little fish swim quickly behind your back – it’s fun!  Jack Hartmann's Five Little Fish song is wonderful for simple addition and counting to 5.

Two little fish swimming in the sea

Here comes another fish, whoops, say “hello”

Splishing and a splashing rockin’ to the beat

videos.title: It's February, Black History Month 2024! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
It's February, Black History Month by Jack Hartmann is a song about black historians and their contributions. Learn the names and legacies of the people we celebrate during black history month and every month.  This song has but a few of the many names that have contributed to black history month. As an extension activity research the many others who have made contributions to black history. 

It’s February, Black History Month Vol. 2
Words by Jack Hartmann, Music by Jack Hartmann and James Cory

It’s February, Black History Month
It’s February, Black History Month                 
Arms up, clap your hands, sing out strong
Celebrate black history in February
And all year long

Hank Aaron is a legend in MLB
And his home run hitting made history
Ella Fitzgerald sang jazz so strong
 She was known as the 1st Lady of Song
Sidney Poiter’s acting shined so bright
He was a movie star hero to black and white
And Cicely Tyson was a movie star, too
She did roles that showed black is beautiful

It’s February, Black History Month
It’s February, Black History Month                 
Arms up, clap your hands, sing out strong
Celebrate black history in February
And all year long

Michell Obama is known in history as the 1st African American 1st Lady
Michael Jordan is known to everyone as the best basketball player ever, under the sun
 
Marie Maynard Daly studied in chemistry
And was the 1st black woman to earn a Ph.D.
Langston Hughes was a poet and he loved to write
He celebrated black culture and black life

Clap, clap, clap
 Tap, tap, tap
 Sway, sway, sway      
Celebrate black history every day

It’s February, Black History Month
 February, Black History Month                 
Arms up, clap your hands, sing out strong
Celebrate black history in February
And all year long

Misty Copeland was the first black ballet dancer
 To earn a principal part in the American Dance Theater
George Washington Carver is known for helping plants grow
 like soybeans, peanuts and sweet potatoes
Shirley Chisholm was an American Politician
And the first African American Congresswoman
Arthur Ashe was a tennis star
Who won championships and helped sick people near and far

It’s February, Black History Month

Arms up, clap your hands, sing out strong
Celebrate black history in February
And all year long

videos.title: A Frog's Life Cycle | Metamorphosis Song for Kids! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
A Frog's Life Cycle song about the Frog’s Life Cycle makes learning about the life cycle of a frog and metamorphosis really simple and fun.  Children can even move and dance to the cool beat and music as they sing the stages in the frog's life cycle; Frog, Egg, Tadpole, Tadpole with legs, and Froglet.
Metamorphosis is a big word and a challenging concept for children to learn, so we really made this frog's life cycle song simple and fun to do and sing.
The Frog’s Life Cycle can be used in the science curriculum for children to learn about life cycles and animal habitats.  Strengthen your science program with some singing and movement fun.
We even try to help children learn how to spell metamorphosis at the end of our frog life cycle song.

A Frog's Life Cycle Lyrics by Jack Hartmann

videos.title: Blendable Letter Sounds | Zed Version | UFLI | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Blendable Letter Sounds Zed Version by Jack Hartmann in collaboration with the University of Florida Literacy Institute  (UFLI) demonstrates how to pronounce letter sounds when teaching reading. When children are learning to read, they need to blend sounds as they decode. Teachers need to ensure that the sounds they are modeling are sounds that can be blended. Blendable Letter Sounds Song presents each letter sound in a blendable way with the sound and a word association for each letter. Jack demonstrates the blendable sound and the correct mouth formation for each letter sound.
University of Florida Literacy Institute in collaboration with Holly Lane, Ph.D. and Valentina Contesse, Ph.D.

Blendable Letter Sounds

Blendable, Letter Sounds, listen and you’ll hear       
Blendable, Letter Sounds, say them nice and clear

The sound for a is /a/ /a/ /a/ apple
The sound for b is /b/ /b/ /b/ ball
The sound for c is /c/ /c/ /c/ cat
The sound for d is /d/ /d/ /d/ dog
The sound for e is /e/ /e/ /e/ edge

videos.title: Blendable Letter Sounds | UFLI |Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Blendable Letter Sounds by Jack Hartmann in collaboration with the University of Florida Literacy Institute (UFLI) demonstrates how to pronounce letter sounds when teaching reading. When children are learning to read, they need to blend sounds as they decode. Teachers need to ensure that the sounds they are modeling are sounds that can be blended. Blendable Letter Sounds Song presents each letter sound in a blendable way with the sound and a word association for each letter. Jack demonstrates the blendable sound and the correct mouth formation for each letter sound.
University of Florida Literacy Institute in collaboration with Holly Lane, Ph.D. and Valentina Contesse, Ph.D.

videos.title: Leap For Leap Day! | Leap Day Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Leap On Leap Day by Jack Hartmann will have you leaping for Leap Day.  Find out that it takes 365 days plus 6 hours each year for the Earth to orbit the Sun. Learn how those 6 extra hours each year add up every 4 years to give us an extra day in February.  Find out how fast the Earth moves to be able to orbit the Sun. Follow Jack's movements and Leap On Leap Day as we have one extra day to learn and play this year.

This year is a Leap Year
And we have to add on a Leap Day
So we add the Leap Day to the end of February
And get 29 days, not 28

Everybody stand up, celebrate
This year is a Leap Year with one extra day
It’s called Leap Day and it was necessary          
To add a day every four years to February

Our earth orbits around the sun
And goes really fast and far
It goes 67,000 miles an hour
Way faster than a jet plane or car
It takes 365 days and six hours
For the Earth to revolve around the sun
So that extra six hours each year for four years
Adds up to one day for everyone

Everybody stand up, celebrate
This year is a Leap Year with one extra day
It’s called Leap Day and it was necessary          
To add a day every four years to February

In one orbit around the sun
The early goes 584 million miles
In one orbit around the sun
The earth goes 584 million miles
February has 28 days
Except in a Leap Year there is 29
Leap Day!  Leap Day!

videos.title: Honey Bees are Cool! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Honey Bees Are Cool© by Jack Hartmann teaches us all about the amazing world of honeybees! Learn about pollination, the queen bee, colony life, and how they make honey. This educational video is perfect for kids and adults who are curious about the important role honeybees play in our environment. Come learn all about honey bees in this fun and educational video by Jack Hartmann!  Plus, find out how they make delicious honey! Perfect for children and adults alike, this video is a must-watch for anyone interested in learning about these incredible creatures.  So come buzz along and discover why honey bees are so cool!
Special thanks go out to Linda Di Gloria and Fran Petrow of Glory Bee Honey Farm for teaching us so much about amazing bees!

videos.title: Beautiful Butterfly | Butterfly Song for Kids! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Beautiful Butterfly© by Jack Hartmann illustrates the life cycle of a butterfly. The four stages in the life cycle of a butterfly (metamorphosis) are beautifully and clearly shown in this real-life music video. Jack and Lisa Hartmann wrote this song, Beautiful Butterfly, to help children in Lisa’s kindergarten class learn the four stages of the life cycle of a butterfly.  The vivid and colorful video includes all the real images of butterflies, their eggs, caterpillars (larvae and the chrysalis) and pupa.  The children will get to sing along with Jack and Lisa’s beautiful song as they clearly see all  four stages of the life cycle of a butterfly.   No drawings, clip art, or cartoons are shown in the video.  All the images of the butterfly’s life cycle are real.  Your children will learn so much about the life cycle of a butterfly as they sing about the four stages and see this amazing video.




Beautiful Butterfly©
Words and Music by Jack  and Lisa Hartmann, Copyright 2005 Jack Hartmann
www.jackhartmann.com

I am a tiny egg on a leaf, I’m very small and so hard to see
But I am growing and changing each day
Soon I’ll be hatching to my next stage
Now I’m a caterpillar chewing so much
I chew my shell and leaves I just munch
The bigger I grow my skin sheds away
Then on a branch, I make the shape of a “J”
I’m growing it’s true, I’ll be a butterfly soon

I’ll fly, I’ll fly 
Flutter my wings all around in the sky        
I’ll fly, I’ll fly
One day I’ll be a beautiful butterfly

Now I’m snug in a safe place
A hard chrysalis protects me each day
Inside I sleep, change and grow
And dream of all the places I’ll go
Now I’m a butterfly with beautiful wings
I stretch them out so they’ll dry for me
I move and pump my wings up and down
Getting ready to fly all around
I’m happy to be a butterfly flying free

I’ll fly, I’ll fly 
Flutter my wings all around in the sky        
I’ll fly, I’ll fly
One day I’ll be a beautiful butterfly

videos.title: Metamorphosis! | Frogs Life Cycle Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Metamorphosis© by Jack Hartmann is a song about the frog’s life cycle. Metamorphosis makes learning about the life cycle of a frog and metamorphosis really simple and fun.  Children can even move and dance to the cool beat and music as they sing the stages in the frog's life cycle; Frog, Egg, Tadpole, Tadpole with legs, and Froglet.
Metamorphosis is a big word and a challenging concept for children to learn so we really made this frog's life cycle song simple and fun to do and sing.
The Frog’s Life Cycle can be used in the science curriculum for children to learn about life cycles and animal habitats.  Strengthen your science program and have some singing and movement fun.
We even try to help children learn how to spell.  Metamorphosis at the end of our frog life cycle song.

videos.title: The Dancing Twos! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Dancing 2’s ©by Jack Hartmann helps students to learn to count to 100 as they skip count by 2’s. To make this a brain-based math activity, have the students hold up two fingers on each hand. As they count by 2’s they should sweep their right hand over to the left side of their body and then back again, doing the same from left to right. Crossing the mid-line (middle) of their body helps to encourage strong development of left brain/right brain communication. Another benefit is strengthening muscle coordination, which can support the development of fine motor skills such as writing numbers and drawing shapes.
Count to 100 by 2's.

videos.title: Secret Stories® Fun! | Jack Hartmann | Best Phonics Song to Get Kids Reading!
videos.description:
Sing along with Jack Hartmann to the Secret Stories® Phonics Song and learn the "secrets" to reading words instead of memorizing them! For more phonics “secrets” to help your child learn to read, visit https://www.TheSecretStories.com and join the "Secret Group” on Facebook- http://bit.ly/SecretsGroup.  
For more phonics “secrets” to help your child learn to read, visit https://www.TheSecretStories.com​ and join the Secret Group on Facebook- http://bit.ly/SecretsGroup. You can also download the Secret Stories® Phonics App in the Apple Store, https://bit.ly/SSPhonicsApp. Secret Stories® is a registered trademark of Marenem, Inc., publisher of "Secret Stories® Cracking the Reading Code with the Brain in Mind" by Katie Garner.

Secret Stories® make phonics easy to know
And they're fun to learn so you don't have to go slow
Secret Stories® are the tools you need to never memorize words that you can read
To read words like
her
bird
and sure
You need to know the Secret Story® that says er
Er, it, ur don't know how to drive
So they stop real fast and make the tires fly
Secret Stories® make phonics easy to know
And they're fun to learn so you don't have to go slow
Secret Stories® are the tools you need to never memorize words that you can read
To read words like
now
about
and how
You need to know the Secret Story® that says ow
 Ou and ow play too rough, and they always get hurt cause they're not so tough
Secret Stories® make phonics easy to know
And they're fun to learn so you don't have to go slow
Secret Stories® are the tools you need to never memorize words that you can read
To read words like
yes
candy
and my
You need to know the three sounds of sneaky y
He stole the superhero sounds of e and I
But he just says /y/ when he's the first in line
Secret Stories® make phonics easy to know
And they're fun to learn so you don't have to go slow
Secret Stories® are the tools you need to never memorize words that you can read
Never memorize words that you can read

videos.title: Build New Words | Prefix and Suffix for Kids | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Build New Words© by Jack Hartmann demonstrates how prefixes and suffixes can completely change the meaning of a word.  Jack Hartmann teaches kids how to build new words using prefixes and suffixes! Watch as he shows how adding prefixes and suffixes can completely change the meaning of a word. Great for young learners!


Build New Words© Lyrics
Hey look, here's a cool way to build new words
All you've got to do is start with a root word
Add a prefix or suffix, or both
And your words and meanings can grow and grow
Your words and meanings can grow and grow
A prefix is a word part with a specific meaning at the beginning of a word
A suffix is a word part with a specific meaning at the beginning of a word
A root word is a main part of a word, that contains its core meaning
Let's start with the root word do
Do means perform an action
Add the prefix un to the root word do
And you get the word undo
Undo means cancel or reverse
Undo is the opposite of do
Let's start with the root word care
Care means show concern
Add the suffix less to the root word care
And you get the word careless
Careless means showing no concern
Careless is the opposite of care
Let's start with the root word appear
Appear means to come into sight
Add the prefix dis to the root word appear
And you get the word disappear
Disappear means no longer in sight
Disappear is the opposite of appear
Hey look, here's a cool way to build new words
All you've got to do is start with a root word
Add a prefix or suffix, or both
And your words and meanings can grow and grow
Your words and meanings can grow and grow
Let's start with the root word teach
Teach means give instruction
Add the suffix er to the  root word teach
And you get the word teacher
Teacher, means a person who instructs
Teach means give instruction
Let's start with the root word, play
Play means to have fun
Add the prefix re to the root word, play
And you get the word replay
Replay means play again
Play means to have fun
Hey look, here's a cool way to build new words
All you've got to do is start with a root word
Add a prefix or suffix, or both
And your words and meanings can grow and grow
Your words and meanings can grow and grow

videos.title: There are 44 Phonemes!  | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
There are 44 Phonemes© by Jack Hartmann demonstrates the 44 phonemes in the English language.  There are just 26 letters in the English language and there are approximately 44 unique sounds.  These sounds are known as phonemes. The 44 sounds (phonemes)  help distinguish one word or meaning from another. Various letters and letter combinations known as graphemes are used to represent the sounds. 
 The 44 English sounds fall into the two categories of consonants and vowels. Below is a list of the 44 phonemes, their International Phonetic Alphabet symbols, and some examples of their use. There is no definitive list of phonemes because of accents, dialects, and the evolution of language itself.  You may discover lists that are a variation of these 44 sounds.    
Jack Hartmann teaches the 44 phonemes in a fun and engaging way. Perfect for educators and parents looking to help children learn about phonics!

44 Phonemes Lyrics

Phonemes are the smallest unit of sound that make up words
There are 44 Phonemes
To help you write and read       
44 Phonemes for you and me
Hear them, say them, and learn them now
44 Phonemes, I’ll show you how

Let’s start with the consonant phonemes
   
1.     /b/ as in ball
2.    /d/as in dog
3.    /f/ as in fish
4.    /g/ as in goat
5.    /h/ as in hand
6.    /j/ as in jet
7.    /k/ as in car
8.    /l/ as in leaf
9.    /m/ as in mouse
10.  /n/ as in nose
11.  /ng/ as sing /ŋ/ 
12.  /p/ as in pig
13.  /r/ as in run
14.  /s/ as in sun
15. /zh/ as in treasure /ʒ/
  
16. /t/ as in tiger
17. /v/ as in van
18. /w/ as in watch
19. /y/ as yo-yo
20. /z/ as in zip
21.  /ch/ as in child  /tʃ/
22.  /sh/ as in shoes /ʃ/
23.  /th/ as in mother /θ/
24.  /th/ as in third /ð/

There are 44 Phonemes
To help you write and read       
44 Phonemes for you and me
Hear them, say them, and learn them now
44 Phonemes, I’ll show you how

These are the vowel phonemes

25.  /a/ as in apple /æ /
26.  /e/ as in egg  /ɛ /
27.  /i/ as in igloo   /ɪ/
28.  /o/ as in octopus   /ɔ/
29.  /u/ as in umbrella /ʌ /
30.  /ae/ as in rain /aɪ /
31.  /aw/ as in paw  /ɔ/
32.  /ee/ as in tree /i /
33.  /ie/ as in in light  /aɪ/
34.  /oa/ as in boat  /oʊ/
35.  /ue/ as in statue  / u:/
36.  /oo/ as in food  /u /
37.  /oo/ as in book /ʊ /
38.  /ou/ as in cow /aʊ /
39.  /oi/ as in boy /ɔɪ /

These are the r controlled vowels
40.  /ar/ as in jar
41.  /er/ as in bird /ɜː/
42.  /air/ as in chair /eə/
43.  /ear/ as in clear /ɪə/
44.  /or/ as in fork

There are 44 Phonemes to help you write and read

44 Phonemes!

videos.title: Pound and Sound© | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Pound and Sound© by Jack Hartmann is a kinesthetic approach to help students blend words and isolate (segment) sounds. Jack pounds his fist to say the word, and then he sounds out each sound in the word by using a finger for each sound. Jack then pounds his fist again to represent blending the sounds in each word together to pound the word.
Pound and Sound is a fun and interactive way for students to blend words and isolate sounds. Join Jack Hartmann in this educational and engaging video!

Pound and Sound Lyrics

Pound and Sound, have fun and learn
Pound and Sound, the sounds in words
Use your ears, your brain, and hands
And do the very best you can

Now, let’s pound the word
And say the sounds you hear
As you put up one finger at a time

Pound and Sound
cat / c /  /a / / t/ cat
bat / b/ / a/ / t / bat
leg / l / /e/ /g/  leg
dig  /d/ / i /  /g / dig

Pound and Sound, have fun and learn
Pound and Sound, the sounds in words
Use your ears, your brain, and hands
And do the very best you can

Top  /t / /o /  /p / top

You're doing great, let's do more

videos.title: The Triangle Song! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
The Triangle Song by Jack Hartmann is a fun way to learn about triangles. Triangles are two-dimensional shapes with three sides, three vertices, and three straight lines. Look for triangles in our environment and learn about common objects around us that have the shape of a triangle.

The Triangle Song Lyrics

This is a triangle, it has 3 sides
Three corners or vertices and 3 straight lines
Remember a triangle has 3 angles you see
That always add up to 180 degrees
And I've got to say, a triangle's a 2D shape
This is a triangle, it has 3 sides
Three corners or vertices and 3 straight lines
Remember a triangle has 3 angles you see
That always add up to 180 degrees
And I've got to say, a triangle's a 2D shape
Now draw a triangle in the air with me
Now let's look at some things that have the shape of a triangle
This pizza slice has the shape of a triangle
This roof has the shape of a triangle
This sign has the shape of a triangle
This kite has the shape of a triangle
This is a triangle, it has 3 sides
Three corners or vertices and 3 straight lines
Remember a triangle has 3 angles you see
That always add up to 180 degrees
And I've got to say, a triangle's a 2D shape

videos.title: Symmetry! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Symmetry by Jack Hartmann teaches that symmetry is when an object looks the same on both sides. If an object has symmetry, it's called symmetrical. Move with Jack to demonstrate if an object is symmetrical or nonsymmetrical.  If the object is symmetrical, place 2 hands in the air. If the object is nonsymmetrical or asymmetrical, place both arms down to one side.
Identify objects as symmetrical or nonsymmetrical and living things as symmetrical or nonsymmetrical.



Symmetry Lyrics
Symmetry, symmetry
Is when an object looks the same on both sides
Symmetry, symmetry
The line down the middle is a symmetry line
Each side matches perfectly
Each side of the line of symmetry
 If an object has symmetry it's called symmetrical
If an object doesn't have symmetry it's called asymmetrical or nonsymmetrical
Now let's look at some objects
If it's symmetrical, raise both arms straight up high
If it's nonsymmetrical, move both arms down to one side

I'll show kindness
I'll show kindness
Straight from my heart
Straight from my heart
So celebrate
So celebrate

And sing out loud
Happy New Year
Happy New Year
And this is the year 20__  __

Have High Hopes For a Great New Year
Let the love in your heart, shine a light in the dark

And show my love

And sing out loud

Be helpful, be happy, eat lots of good foods
Be brave  and try hard at everything I do

videos.title: Let's Make a Chain of Words! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Let's Make a Chain of Words by Jack Hartmann is a phonemic awareness activity. Jack starts with a word, and then changes one phoneme to create another word. In this chain of words, Jack starts with a word and then changes the initial consonant, then he changes the medial sound, the next time he changes the ending sound and lastly, he changes the initial sound again all to create a Chain of Words.  Look for our other Chain of Words videos that segment the sounds to create a Chain of Words. 

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor

Let's start with the word cat
Change c to b, and you get the word bat
Change a to u, and you get the word but
Change t to g, and you get the word bug
Change b to m, and you get the word mug
We made a chain of words

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor

Let's start with the word dog
Change d to h, and you get the word hog
Change g to m, and you get the word hum
Change h to g, and you get the word gum
We made a chain of words

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor

videos.title: Let's Make a Chain of Words! | Segmented Phonics Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Let's Make a Chain of Words, Segmented Phonics Version by Jack Hartmann is a phonemic awareness activity. Jack starts with a word, and then changes one letter to create another word. In this chain of words. Jack segments and then blends the words each time he changes the letter in the chain. Jack starts with a word and then changes the initial consonant, then changes the medial sound, the next time he changes the ending sound and lastly, he changes the initial sound again all to create a Chain of Words.  Look for our other Chain of Words videos that are not segmented for more of a challenge to this skill.

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor
Look and listen to which letter sound we change to make a new word

Let's start with the word cat, /c//a//t/, cat
/c//a//t/ cat
Change /c /to /b/ /b//a//t/  bat
/b//a//t/ bat
Change a to u,/ b//u//t/ but
/b//u//t/ but
Change t to g, /b//u//g/ bug
/b//u//g/ bug
Change b to m, /m//u//g/ mug
/m//u//g/ mug
We made a chain of words

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor

Let's start with the word dog
Change d to h, /h//o//g/ hog
/h//o//g/  hog
Change g to m,  /h//u//m/ hum
/h//u//m/ hum
Change h to g, /g//u//m/ gum
/g//u//m/ gum
We made a chain of words

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor
