videos.title: Let's Make a Chain of Words 2!  | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Let's Make a Chain of Words 2 by Jack Hartmann is a phonemic awareness activity. Jack starts with a word, and then changes one letter to create another word. In this chain of words, Jack starts with a word and then changes the initial consonant, then he changes the medial sound, the next time he changes the ending sound and lastly, he changes the initial sound again all to create a Chain of Words.  Look for our other Chain of Words videos that segment the sounds to create a Chain of Words. Join Jack Hartmann as we continue the fun with a chain of words! This engaging word chain activity will help improve vocabulary and language skills in a fun and interactive way.  This version is an open-ended version that asks students to name the new word in the chain independently.

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor

Let's start with the word dig
Change d to p, and you get the word pig
Change i to e, and you get the word peg
Change g to t, and you get the word pet
Change p to s, and you get the word set
We made a chain of words

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor

Let's start with the word sun
Change s  to f, and you get the word fun
Change u  to i , and you get the word fin
Change n to t, and you get the word fit
Change f to s, and you get the word sit
We made a chain of words

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more
You can make words from the ceiling to the floor

Let's Make a Chain of Words 2, Segmented Phonics Version by Jack Hartmann is a phonemic awareness activity. Jack starts with a word, and then changes one phoneme to create another word. In this chain of words. Jack segments and then blends the words each time he changes the letter in the chain. Jack starts with a word and then changes the initial consonant, then the medial sound, the next time he changes the ending sound and lastly, he changes the initial sound again all to create a Chain of Words.  Look for our other Chain of Words videos that are not segmented for more of a challenge to this skill.

Let's make a chain
A chain of words
It's really fun
Have you heard?
You start with one word and make so many more

Change i to e, /p//e//g/ peg

Change g to t, /p//e//t/ pet

We made a chain of words

Let's make a chain

It's really fun

videos.title: Go For It! | Inspirational Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Go For It by Jack Hartmann. This song was inspired by our friend and fellow educator, Mr. Greg, from Kindergarten Smorgasboard.  I was listening to an interview with Mr. Greg and he expressed  that "going for it" is something we can all learn from our students.  Mr Greg's statement evolved to this song, "Go for it." I hope this song serves to help you find your wings to Go For It!
 Get motivated with "Go For It" by Jack Hartmann! This uplifting song will inspire you to reach for your goals and never give up. Let's go for it together!

videos.title: The Blendable Letter Sound Exercise Song! | Zed Version | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Blendable Letter Sound Exercise Song Zed Version, by Jack Hartmann will build your body and brain as you work out to the blendable letter sounds. For each group of letters, Jack will show an exercise for the letter, a different exercise for the sound, and a third exercise for the word associated with each letter. Music and movement in learning incorporate kinesthetic, visual, tactile, and auditory modalities. Music and movement also builds synapsis in the brain and increases brain plasticity.
Get moving and learning with this energizing music video!

videos.title: Happy St. Patrick's Day! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Happy St. Patrick's Day by Jack Hartmann is a great way to get in the St. Patrick's Day spirit as you sing and move along with Jack with St. Patrick's Day dances to celebrate this fun holiday.
Join Jack Hartmann as he celebrates St. Patrick's Day with fun and engaging songs and dances. Sing and move along to these special St. Patrick's Day tunes to get into the festive spirit!  Get your kids moving and grooving to the beat of Irish music.
As a fun extension make up your own dances for St. Patrick's Day.


Happy St. Patrick’s Day

Let’s sing and dance
And celebrate St. Patrick’s Day together

Everybody clap your hands
Happy St. Patrick’s Day
Everybody stomp one foot
Sing, dance, and play
Everybody turn around
Happy St. Patrick's Day
Happy St. Patrick’s Day

Do the Leprechaun Dance
Bend knees out side to side
Swing arms left and right
Dance, dance, do the Leprechaun Dance
Dance, dance, do the Leprechaun Dance

Do the Rainbow Dance
Feet go side to side
Arms sway up high
Dance, dance, do the Rainbow Dance
Dance, dance, do the Rainbow Dance

Everybody clap your hands
Happy St. Patrick’s Day
Everybody stomp one foot
Sing, dance, and play
Everybody turn around
Happy St. Patrick's Day
Happy St. Patrick’s Day

Do the Pot of Gold Dance
Toss gold coins up high
Lean left and right
Dance, dance, do the Pot of Gold Dance
Dance, dance, do the Pot of Gold Dance

Do the Four-Leaf Clover Dance
Together two arms up high
Two legs up one at a time
Dance, dance, do the Four-Leaf Clover Dance
Dance, dance, do the Four-Leaf Clover Dance

Everybody clap your hands
Happy St. Patrick’s Day
Everybody stomp one foot
Sing, dance, and play
Everybody turn around
Happy St. Patrick's Day
Happy St. Patrick’s Day

Happy St. Patrick’s Day!

videos.title: Finger Fun! | Hand and Finger Dexterity Exercises for Kids! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Finger Fun by Jack Hartmann is a fun and engaging way to increase both hand and finger dexterity and strength. 
Follow along with the creative moves Jack developed to increase dexterity.  For added fun, feel free to have the following props on hand:
Tennis balls to squeeze
Scarfs for butterfly wings
 Spider rings for crawling
A little box of sand for the crab crawl
Tissue paper for jellyfish tentacles
Black and white strips of paper glued to resemble piano keys.

Have Finger Fun as your fingers and hands get stronger and have increased agility


Finger Fun Lyrics
Hold one hand up, 5 fingers
Two hands up, 10 fingers
Make them wave
Make them wiggle
Come on everyone, let's have Finger Fun
Both hands up, squeeze the ball
Squeeze, squeeze, squeeze the ball
Hands out front, spider crawl
Crawl, crawl, spider crawl
Hand to the side, butterfly
Fly, fly, butterfly
Hands in the water, dolphin dive
Dive, dive, dolphin dive
Hold one hand up, 5 fingers
Two hands up, 10 fingers
Make them wave
Make them wiggle
Come on everyone, let's have Finger Fun
Finger and thumb, crab pinch
Pinch, pinch, crab pinch
Hands face down, piano play
Play, play, piano play
Both hands up gator chomp
Chomp, chomp, gator chomp
Fingers out, jellyfish jiggle
Jiggle, jiggle, jellyfish jiggle
Hold one hand up, 5 fingers
Two hands up, 10 fingers
Make them wave
Make them wiggle
Come on everyone, let's have Finger Fun

See It, Say It, Sign It, Zed version, by Jack Hartmann, teaches sign language for each letter and the letter sounds for each letter of the alphabet with American sign language.  Jack shows the sign for each letter and the letter sounds for each letter as he sings the letter name and the letter is shown on the screen. This version also includes the letter sounds and objects beginning with the letter sound.  This is a simple and fun way to learn sign language for each letter of the alphabet.  As a fun follow up challenge, have each student spell their name using signs for each letter.  ASL alphabet. A fun and interactive way to learn asl.

The Bunny Hop Bop by Jack Hartmann is a fun way to celebrate spring as you flop your ears,
shake your tail, and hop with your bunny feet, all to the same pattern that Jack introduces.

videos.title: I Am Somebody! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
"I Am Somebody!" by Jack Hartmann is a powerful child advocacy song that promotes self-confidence and positivity in kids. Sing along and feel empowered!  I Am Somebody empowers kids to believe in themselves and reach their full potential. I Am Somebody teaches us all to embrace our differences and strengths to be our authentic selves, look for the good in others, and use our special gifts.

There's one thing I know for sure

I've got special gifts

Positive Power is the key to keep trying when the going gets rough.
Join Jack Hartmann in his catchy and uplifting song, "Positive Power," that teaches us all about the importance and benefits of being positive in life! Music and positivity can improve your mood and spirit. This positivity song is also about endurance and perseverance to continue reaching your goals when things stand in the way.  In "Positive Power" by Jack Hartmann, learn about the importance of being positive in this uplifting and motivational song for kids and families.

videos.title: Brain and Body Dance Break! | Jack Hartmann
videos.description:
Brain and Body Dance Break by Jack Hartmann will have students dancing and getting recharged to learn as they dance in this brain break video. Brain breaks are important for students. Brain breaks help improve focus and reduce stress and anxiety. Brain breaks are an important tool to help students assimilate knowledge before they return to further lessons. Brain breaks help the brain process,  organize, and integrate information, leading to better memory retention and recall. Get up and dance and watch students have fun with Jack Hartmann's Brain and Body Dance Break.


Brain and Body Dance Break Lyrics

If you’ve been working real hard
And you need a little break
There’s something you can do to feel better right away
Just turn the music up
And move your body to the beat
Do the Brain and Body Dance Break with me!

Right leg out, stomp three times, one, two, three
Left leg out, stomp three times, one, two, three
Both elbows out, flap, flap, flap 
Dance like a chicken
Just like that
Now move in slow motion like you're dancing on the moon dance
Do the walking on the moon dance
Nice and cool
Now wiggle, wiggle, wiggle, way down low
Then bring it back up nice and slow
Now get on your horse, ride, ride, ride
One arm up, circle round, with your lasso up high

The Brain and Body Dance Break, woohoo!
 Brain and Body Dance Break, woohoo!            
Have fun and move from your head to your feet
Do the Brain and Body Dance Break with me

Now roll your hands around like the wheels on a bus 
Roll them way down, then back up
Lean your body to the left, lean your body to the right
Left, right, left, right
Now one hand up, give an air high five
Do the bunny hop, hop, hop, hop
Do the bunny hop, hop, hop, stop
Now do your own dance, let’s have fun
Move your arms, legs, hips, and feet
Dance everyone, dance, dance
You did great, now celebrate
Clap your hands, clap, clap, clap your hands
Clap, clap, clap your hands
Clap, clap, clap your hands

videos.description:
Join us for a super fun livestream with Jack Hartmann! Sing and dance along to his educational songs for kids that make learning fun. Perfect for the whole family to enjoy! Don't miss out on this exciting event with Jack Hartmann, a beloved children's musician and educator.  Your kids will love dancing and singing along to these educational songs by Jack Hartmann. Don't miss out on this musical adventure that combines learning and entertainment!

Jack’s music is research-based and teacher-approved to focus on helping children learn important state, national, and early childhood standards.  All of Jack’s songs and videos engage children with not only great educational content but with cool beats kids love.
Get ready for a fun and educational livestream with Jack Hartmann, the king of educational songs for kids! Join us for a variety of interactive and engaging songs to keep your little ones entertained and learning at the same time. Don't miss out on this super fun session with Jack Hartmann!
